loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 50 years old. He is married with eight children aged between 5 and 29 years, all of whom go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 25 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow maize. He will then sell his maize harvest at a local market. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his maize crops

loans.name: Jacky

texts.en:
Jacky is 39 years old. She is married with four children aged between 4 and 16 years old. She is a farmer and has been farming for seven years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizer to grow maize and beans. The profits generated from his maize and beans harvest will be used to pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow maize and beans.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 31 years old. He is married with two children aged between two and six years old, one of them goes to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for nine years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow maize. The profits from his maize harvest will be used to buy food for home consumption. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow maize

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 54 years old. He is married and has six children, aged between 7 and 29 years. He is a farmer. He has been farming for 10 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow beans and maize. The profits from the harvest will be used to pay school fees for his children. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow beans and maize

loans.name: Cyprien

texts.en:
Cyprien is 41 years old. He is married with five children aged between 4 and 20 years; all of them attend school. He is a farmer and has been farming for nine years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow maize. The profits generated by selling his harvest will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his maize crops

loans.name: Gakumba Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 34 years old. He is married with two children aged 2 and 6 years; one of them goes to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for two years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow maize. The profits made from selling his maize harvest will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow maize

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is 40 years old. He is married with one child who is seven years old and goes to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 10 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow maize. The profits from his maize harvest will be used to buy food for home consumption. 


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow maize

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Imani

texts.en:
Imani is a married woman and has 3 kids of whom two attend school and the other one is still young for school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Imani has operated a tailoring business for the past 10 years to both men and women. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es:
John, con 57 años de edad, se ha dedicado por muchos años a vender abarrotes en una tienda en el municipio de Medellín; de esta forma complementa los ingresos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos.

Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido luchar incansablemente, siempre buscando la manera de salir adelante, esto lo impulsa a solicitar el crédito para comprar una vitrina y comprará surtido al por mayor (mecato, gaseosas, dulces, productos de panadería, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y tendrá más variedad de artículos para ofrecer a los clientes, mejorando así las ventas y los ingresos.

John manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder adquirir un local propio para montar su negocio y lograr que sea mucho más rentable y que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

El confía en el apoyo de la Corporación interactuar y en los prestamistas de Kiva para lograr este objetivo.

Presta y aporta hoy, anímate!
texts.en:
John is 57 years old and for many years has worked selling groceries in a store in the Medellin municipality. In this way he has been able to use his income to help his children get ahead. His tenacity and perseverance have enabled him to tirelessly fight. He is always seeking ways to be successful, therefore he seeks a loan to buy a display case and a stock of items at wholesale (pastries, soda pop, candy, bakery products, and others). This will enable him to continue working and he will have a greater variety of products to offer his customers, thus improving his sales and income.

John states that his primary goal is to be able to acquire his own locale in which to locate his business and be able to be much more profitable, guaranteeing him favorable economic stability in order to provide the best quality of life for his family. He trusts in the support from Interactuar and the Kiva lenders to achieve this goal.

Come on, lend and support him today!

loans.use: to buy a display case and pastries, candy, bakery products and other items.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: RAUL: Es un señor emprendedor y alegre, originario de Waspam, tiene 57 años de edad, soltero, tiene tres hijos, mayores de edad e independientes. Al no contar con un empleo formal decidió emprender su pequeño negocio hace unos años. Construyó un anexo de madera en su casa de habitación, localizada en un punto estratégico  de Waspam, carretera a Puerto Cabezas, donde estableció su pequeña pulpería en la que vende productos básicos, caramelos, galletas, huevos, sopas instantáneas, entre otros productos, generando ingresos propios con lo cual aporta económicamente en el hogar.  Está solicitando por primera vez un crédito para comprar más mercadería, para incrementar su oferta y mejorar sus ingresos también. Su sueño es llegar a ser un exitoso comerciante
texts.en: Raul is an enterprising and happy man originally form Waspam. He is 57 years old, single, has three grown and independent children. Upon not having formal work he decided to start a small business a few years ago. He built a wooden annex on his home, which is located at a strategic location in Waspam, on Puerto Cabezas highway, where he established a small convenience store where he sells basic products, caramels, cookies, eggs, instant soups, and other items. He generates his own income which he uses to support his home. He is seeking a loan for the first time in order to buy more merchandise in order to increase his offerings and also improve his income. His dream is to become a successful merchant.

loans.use: to buy basic products, caramels, cookies, eggs, instant soups, and other items.

loans.name: Letty Raquel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito De Mujeres Unidas se reúne en la ciudadela San Alejo de la bellísima ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida por las hermosas playas que recorren todas sus costas y que son muy visitadas por los turistas nacionales e internacionales.
En este lugar vive la señora Letty, tiene 35 años de edad mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen dos hijos de 15 y 10 años que  estudian en colegio y escuela. Su marido es contratista.
Doña Letty es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos colaborar con los gastos que generan la educación de sus hijos se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo y productos Yanbal, Belcorp (perfumes, cosméticos, cremas, accesorios, entre otras cosas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, ella sale a recorrer por su localidad dos o tres días a la semana más que todo por las mañanas ya que a esta hora es más fresco, deja sus productos a crédito y  cobra cada 8 días, lleva 8 años en este negocio el cual  lo empezó con su primer crédito que recibió del grupo.
Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas, bisutería y cosméticos. Lleva 8 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos comenzo su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir aumentando sus ventas.
texts.en:
The Grupo De Crédito De Mujeres Unidas communal bank meets in San Alejo in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabita. The area is known for its beautiful beaches along all the coast. The beaches are frequented by national and international tourists.
Letty lives here. She is 35 and in a relationship. She has two children ages 15 and 10. They are in school. Her partner is a contractor.
Letty is a very good mother and housewife who, in order to obtain her own income and help out with her children's education costs, she has a business. She sells clothing of all kinds as well as Yanbal and Belcorp products (perfumes, cosmetics, creams, accessories, and others). She sells door-to-door and goes out two or three times per week, usually in the mornings because it's cooler at that time. She leaves her products on credit and charges every 8 days. She has had this business for 8 years. She started it with her first loan which she obtained from this group.
She will use this loan to purchase clothing, perfume, cream, jewellery, and cosmetics. She has been in the community bank for 8 years and she likes it because she used the loans to start her business. 
She dreams of increasing her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfume, jewellery and cosmetics.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El Sr. Jose trabaja como vendedor en una Ferretería, y estudia química y farmacia, es una persona muy sacrificada que quiere ser alguien en la vida, es por eso que se esfuerza.
 Su visión para el futuro es de ejercer su profesión en una entidad de salud y de abrir su propia Farmacia y distribuidora en el rubro farmacéutico.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera para poder seguir sus estudios.
texts.en:
Sr. Jose works as a salesman at a hardware store. He is also studying Chemistry and Pharmacology. Jose is a self-sacrificing individual who wants to make something out of his life. For this reason, he is striving to do his best.

His vision for the future is to pursue a career with a health organization, open his own pharmacy, and become a distributor in the pharmaceutical trade. He is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the payment of his degree fees. This will allow him to continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Norberto earns a livelihood by engaging in raising and selling hogs. He is a 56-year-old married man with two grown children from Dulag, Leyte. Aside from that, he also engages in the rice retail business. He sells rice to the people in his community. He is in need of capital to finance his other source of income.

He is asking for a loan to buy several sacks of rice to resell. In this way, Norberto can sell more rice to his customers and slowly, it will help augment his sales. He can then start to roll his capital and pay his obligations.

Norberto hopes to help his business become more sustainable and hopes to improve his family's status of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of rice to resell and supplement the income from his hog business.

loans.name: Natalia Marisol

texts.es: Natalia de 19 años de edad es una joven emprendedora que se gana la vida vendiendo ropa interior en los mercados de forma ambulante lo que le permite salir adelante y pagarse sus estudios de educación superior ya que ella desea tener una mejor calidad de vida, y sabe que la mejor manera para lograrlo es con el estudio. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar desde hace muchos años por lo que es reconocida en su cantón como una joven trabajadora. Natalia desea invertir en su negocio ya que se acerca la época navideña y ella desea tener suficiente mercadería para ofrecer a su clientela, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: brasier, blúmer, bóxer, calzoncillos, calcetines, calcetas, camisetas, etc.
texts.en:
Natalia, age 19, is an enterprising young woman who earns her living by selling undergarments at the markets as a street vendor. This allows her to get ahead and be able to pay for her higher education. Natalia wants to have a better quality of life and knows that the best way to achieve this is through her studies. She resides in her own home along with her family. For many years, she has been known in her canton for being a hardworking young woman.

Natalia wants to invest in her business since the Christmas season is approaching. She wants to have enough merchandise to offer to her customers. For this reason, Natalia is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in brassieres, bloomers, boxer shorts, briefs, dress socks, athletic socks, T-shirts, and other products.

loans.use: to buy brassieres, bloomers, boxer shorts, briefs, dress socks, athletic socks, T-shirts, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and new seedlings to have a more productive farm.

loans.name: Nazario

texts.en:
Nazario engages in farming and grows rice. He is is a married man with seven dependents, four of whom are still attending school. He lives in Dulag, Leyte.  In addition to that, he also raises and sells hogs. He has been engaged in that business for 3 years now.
 
Nazario has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy rice seedlings, fertilizers and pesticides. These materials are very useful in improving the yield of his farm so he can sell higher volume of rice.

In the future, Nazario is determined to successfully manage his business to maintain a sustainable livelihood and finance the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy rice seedlings, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma.Teresa is a resident in the town of Dulag, Leyte. She is married with six  children. Her oldest is child is 16 and the youngest is 8. She engages in selling rtw (ready to wear), ranging from t-shirts, shorts, and pants, to whole dresses and ladies' lingerie. Aside from that, she sells fish. Her husband is a fisherman. She is the one who sells the catch of her husband.

Ma.Teresa has requested a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing nets, and additional stock of rtw. These will help her improve the catch of her husband and sell more variety of rtw (ready to wear). In the future, she is hoping that she will be successful in handling her current business for the welfare of her growing children, including quality education.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing nets, and additional stock of rtw (ready to wear)

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Cañaris, provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva café desde hace más de 10 años, por lo que cuenta con experiencia en el rubro. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos como guano de isla, roca fosfórica, entre otros, para su cultivo de café. Con esto logrará mejorar la productividad de su cultivo, lo cual le permitirá tener una óptima cosecha y mejorar la calidad de su producto, generando mayores ingresos y mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 35 years old. He lives with his wife and their three children in the Cañaris District, Ferreñafe Province, Lambayeque Region, on the northern coast of Peru. The population of the district makes a living from agriculture, stockbreeding, and commerce.

Carlos makes a living from agriculture. He has cultivated coffee for more than 10 years, because of which he has experience in the field. He counts on many good personal and work references in his district. The loan will be used for the purchase of fertilizers and compost, such as island guano and phosphorus, among others, for his coffee crop. With this he will be able to improve the productivity of his crops, which will allow him to have an optimal harvest and improve the quality of his product, generating a higher income and improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and compost, such as island guano and phosphorus, among others, for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Efren

texts.en: Efren is married and lives in the Philippines. He has operated a banana farm for over 11 years and earns well for a living. He has repaid successfully his previous loan used for buying fertilizer for his farm. He is now expanding his farm and recently took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer to have a more productive farm. In the future, Efren hopes to improve his farm to ensure a better source of income for a better future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to have a more productive farm.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda owns and operates an agricultural farm, growing rice and other crops for a living. Rhoda has been engaged in this business for many years. She works with her husband on the farm and earns well from these activities. Her farm is doing well and yet, she needs financial assistance to improve it. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming.  

Recently, she took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer and new seedlings in order to have a more productive farm. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and new seedlings to have a more productive farm.

loans.name: Americo

texts.es:
Américo tiene 53 años de edad, es casado, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Callayuc, provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La comunidad donde vive es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Américo se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando café variedad catimor. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo será utilizado para invertir en mantenimiento del terreno cultivable, con la compra de fertilizantes y abono como guano de isla. Con esto, Americo espera mejorar la productividad de su cultivo y la calidad de su producto, lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos, mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Américo is 53, married, and lives in his own rustic home with his wife and two children in the Callayuc district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the north of Peru. The community where he lives is a small rural zone where the locals work in agriculture, livestock, and commerce.

Américo works in agriculture, planting the catimor variety of coffee. He has very good work and personal references in his area. He will use this loan to invest in maintaining his land with the purchase of fertilizer and manure such as local guano. With this, Americo hopes to improve his coffee productivity and quality. This will allow him to improve his income and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Relinda

texts.es:
Relinda tiene 53 años de edad, es casada, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Buenos aires, provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores del distrito se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Relinda se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc.), plástico y cerveza, actividad que realiza desde hace más de 05 años. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en el distrito. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos para su negocio(arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros), con esto logrará contar con un mayor stock en su tienda y podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos, lo que le permitirá aumentar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Relinda is 53, married, and lives with her family in the Buenos Aires district of the Morropon province, Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru. The locals work in agriculture, livestock, and commerce.
Relinda sells groceries (rice, sugar, etc), plastic, and beer. She has had this business for over 5 years. She has very good personal and work references from the area. She will use this loan to purchase more products for her business (rice, sugar, oil and others(. With this, she will have more stock for her store to satisfy her customers' needs. This will generate more income and allow her to increase her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products.

loans.name: Iris Medalit

texts.es:
Iris Medalit tiene 26 años de edad , es conviviente, con dos hijos a su cargo, vive en casa de su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Iris Medalit se dedica al comercio minorista, tiene una bodega en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc. con 02 años de experiencia en el sector, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos para su negocio, como arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc. Esto le servirá para tener mayor variedad de productos con la finalidad de poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, incrementar sus ventas y con esto mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Iris Medalit is 26, and lives with her partner. She has two children to take care of. She lives in the family home in a rural area of the Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru. The local population works in agriculture, livestock, and commerce.
Iris Medalit is a small businessperson. She has a store where she sells basic staples like rice, sugar, and oil. She has two years' experience. Her business is run out of her home. She will use this loan to purchase more products for her business like rice, sugar, and oil. 
This will allow her to have a greater variety of products with the goal of being able to satisfy her clients' needs, increasing her sales, and improving her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Luz Monica

texts.es:
Luz Monica tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, vive junto a su cónyuge y su hijo en una casa de material rústico en el distrito de Pimpingos, provincia de Cutervo, Región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Su población se dedica a la agricultura (café y frutales), crianza de ganado vacuno y animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, patos, etc.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos, gallinas y cerdos, con experiencia en el negocio. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en el distrito. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales, así como para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales, como cuyes y pavos. Con esto, Luz Monica espera mejorar la productividad de su negocio, ofreciendo un mejor producto a sus clientes y satisfaciendo sus necesidades, lo que tendrá un gran impacto en sus ingresos, aumentando así su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Monica is 38, married, and lives with her husband and child in a rustic home in the Pimpingos district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the north of Peru. The locals work in agriculture (coffee and fruit) and raise cattle and small animals like guinea pigs, hens, and ducks.
Luz Monica raises and sells small animals like ducks, hens and hogs. She has experience in this business. She has very good work and personal references from the area. She will use this loan to purchase balanced feed for fattening her animals, and to buy more animals such as guinea pigs and ducks. With this, Luz Monica hopes to increase her business' productivity and offer a better product to her clients. She hopes to satisfy their demand, which will have a great impact on her income and increase her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and more animals.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente, con la ayuda del crédito anterior ha obtenido mejores ganancias en su negocio de crianza de cerdos, ve en ellos una oportunidad de mejorar el negocio pues en la actualidad no es nada fácil lograr hacerlo sin ayuda. Las condiciones de vida familiar son mucho mejor.
Requiere de más capital para comprar 3 cerdos, 5 qq de harinilla y pagara mozos para recolectar una manzana de maicillo cosechado, el cual sirve para alimentar a los cerdos.
texts.en:
With the help of his previous loan, Vicente has earned more profits in his business raising pigs.  He sees them as an opportunity to improve his business, because at the moment it's not easy at all to manage to do it without help.  His family living conditions are much better.

He needs more capital to buy three pigs and five quintals of corn flour, and to pay for labor to collect one manzana of harvested sorghum that he'll use to feed the pigs.

loans.use: to buy three pigs and five quintals of corn flour, and to pay for labor to collect one manzana of harvested sorghum that he'll use to feed the pigs

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Niño Jesus está en su 5to ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4 de las 19 señoras se encuentran con una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Angelina, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, quien tiene una pobreza extrema, pero a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la lavandería que hace está ayudando a su familia con los ingresos que gana.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de suavizantes, jabones, desodorante para ropas y demás. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que pese a las luchas diarias ha ido creciendo.
texts.en:
The group named “Niño Jesus” is in its fifth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are committed to working and helping one another so that they can move forward. The members have taken the poverty elimination survey, which indicated that 4 of the 19 women are in extreme poverty.

One of the members is Sra. Angelina. Her survey indicated that she is at a Stage 1 poverty level, which indicates extreme poverty. Through her efforts and continuous work, Angelina operates a laundry business. She is able to help her family with the income she earns.

Angelina is requesting a loan so that she can invest in fabric softeners, soaps, laundry deodorizers, and other supplies. She is a self-sacrificing woman who is growing despite her daily struggles.

loans.use: to buy fabric softeners, soaps, laundry deodorizers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando de 42 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos 3 varones de 17, 16 y 20 años y una hija de 25 años de edad, además de su nieto de 4 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida como jornalero desde hace 30 años y es gracias a ello que ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia a base de esfuerzo y dedicación. Orlando desea reparar su panel solar ya que en su cantón solo cuentan con energía solar por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: repuestos, batería de carga solar y un control de carga para reparar el panel solar de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Orlando, 42, lives in his own house with his wife and his four children (a daughter, 25, and three sons, ages 17, 16, and 20) as well as his grandson, 4.  He's a hardworking man who has earned a living as a day laborer for 30 years, thanks to which he has managed to get his family ahead with effort and dedication.

Orlando wants to repair a solar panel because they only have solar energy in his canton.  He's asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in parts, a solar battery charger, and a solar charge controller to repair the solar panel on his house.

loans.use: to invest in parts, a solar battery charger, and a solar charge controller to repair the solar panel on his house

loans.name: Cesar Aurelio

texts.es:
Cesar Aurelio tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, reside en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican al comercio y crianza de ganado menor.

El se dedica al servicio de albañilería como ayudante de maestro de obra, además de dedicarse al servicio de transporte como mototaxista. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en el distrito. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de materiales como calaminas, puertas y ventanas para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, lo que le permitirá vivir en condiciones mas adecuadas, mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar Aurelio is 27, in a relationship, and lives in the province of Morropón, Piura region, on the north coast of Peru. The community life is tranquil, and the locals work in business and raise small animals.
He is a bricklayer and helps a master labourer. He also provides a transportation service with a mototaxi. He has very good personal and work references. He will use this loan to purchase materials like doors, windows and more to improve his home. This will allow him to live in better conditions, improving his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy doors, windows, and more to improve his home.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like noodles, cooking oil, canned goods, eggs, soap, toothpaste and seasonings. She is a married woman from Dulag, Leyte with five grown children. It has been almost 10 years that she has been operating her store.

Norma is asking for a loan to buy assorted groceries for the store, and for the maintenance of her internet cafe. With these funds, her store will be filled with a variety of stock, attracting more customers, and her internet cafe will start to operate. Hopefully these improvements will be the start of her livelihood rising up.

In the future, she is hoping that she will be successful in managing her business for sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries for the store, and maintain her internet cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing nets

loans.name: Adelinda

texts.es:
Adelinda tiene 60 años de edad, es casada y no tiene hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Adelinda se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como cuyes, gallinas, patos, etc. con más de 8 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en su domicilio. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en el distrito. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como cerdos, pavos, patos, etc. Dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en su negocio, con gran influencia en su nivel de ingresos. Adelaida espera incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona, lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ganancias y aumentar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adelinda is 60, married, and has no children. She lives with her family in a rural zone of the Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru. The locals work mainly in agriculture, livestock and commerce.
Adelinda raises and sells animals like guinea pigs, hens, and ducks. She has 8 years' experience in this business. She runs the business out of her home. She has very good personal and work references. She will use this loan to purchase more animals like hogs and ducks. This investment will help her to have more variety and productivity in her business. This will increase her income greatly. Adelaida hopes to increase her stock of animals in order to attend to the diverse needs of her clients. This will allow her to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more animals like hogs, and ducks.

loans.name: Maria Clara

texts.es:
María Clara tiene 29 años de edad, es casada, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos en una casa de material rústico en el Caserío El Frayle, distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Su población se dedica a la agricultura (café, yucas y maíz) y crianza de animales menores.

María Clara se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, patos y cerdos, su negocio se ubica en la parte externa de su domicilio. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en el distrito. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de alimento balanceado como maíz y polvillo para engorde de sus animales y para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales para su negocio. Esto le permitirá contar con una mayor producción y de mejor calidad, lo que le permitirá satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de sus clientes, obteniendo mayores ingresos, y por ende aumentará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Clara is 29 and lives with her partner and two young children in a rustic home in the El Frayle hamlet, Santo Tomas district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the north of Peru. The population works in agriculture (coffee, yucca, and corn) and raises small animals.
Maria Clara raises and sells small animals like guinea pigs, hens, ducks, and hogs from the back of her home. She has very good work and personal references. She will use this loan to purchase balanced animal feed such as corn and power to fatten the animals, and to buy more animals for her business. This will allow her to have better and more production and to satisfy her customers' needs and tastes. She will obtain a greater income and increase her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced food and animals.

loans.name: Maneelath Group

texts.en:
Khamseo's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village, including Khamseo’s, are able to buy bottled water.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    

Khamseo is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other waterborne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Khamseo due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor tiene 44 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos. Él se dedica a la comercialización de ganado y además cuenta con una tienda de cereales(maíz y frijoles) y de esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar y se gana la vida honradamente. Víctor desea construir un cuarto en su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: arena, ladrillo, cemento, hierro, grava, etc.
texts.en:
Víctor, 44, lives in his own house with his two children.  He earns a living selling livestock and also has a cereal store (corn and beans).  That's how he supports his household and earns an honest living.

Víctor wants to build a room on his house so he's asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in buying the necessary materials, including sand, bricks, cement, rebar, and gravel.

loans.use: to buy sand, bricks, cement, rebar, gravel, etc. to build a room

loans.name: Taurino

texts.es:
Taurino tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos en una casa de material rústico, en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio.

Taurino se dedica al cultivo de café, tiene 10 años de experiencia en el sector y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, entre otros insumos, para mejorar la productividad de su cultivo, esto le permitirá tener una óptima cosecha y mejorar la calidad de su producto, lo que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos, y con esto aumentar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Taurino is 43 years old and lives with his wife and their four children in a house made of basic materials. They reside in the District of Pucará in Jaén Prvoince, which is in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. The residents of this district engage in agriculture and trade.

Taurino grows coffee and has 10 years of experience in this trade. He has many good personal and work-related references who live in his district. His loan will be used to buy fertilizers, compost, and other supplies so that he can improve the productivity of his crops. This will result in an optimal harvest and a better quality product. Taurino will be able to earn more income and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and other supplies so that he can improve the productivity of his crops.

loans.name: Abdias

texts.es:
Abdias tiene 44 años de edad, es casado, vive con su cónyuge y su nieto en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Querocotillo, provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Abdias se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de maíz, con 15 años de experiencia en el sector. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El destino del crédito será para invertir en labores de mantenimiento de su cultivo como el pago de peones para la época de cosecha, así como para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para mejorar su producción. Con esto, Abdias espera mejorar la calidad de su producto, incrementando sus ingresos y mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Abdias is 44, married, and lives with his wife and grandchild in his own rustic home in the Querocotillo district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the north of Peru. The local population works in agriculture, livestock and commerce.
Abdias works in agriculture, particularly corn. He has 15 years' experience in the area. He has very good personal and work references. He will use this loan to invest in maintaining his crops by paying the labourers for the harvest, and buying manure and fertilizer to improve production. With this, Abdias hopes to improve the quality of his product, to increase his income, and to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a 46-year-old married woman with nine children. Seven of her children are still attending school. She lives in Dulag, Leyte. She raises and sells hogs. She has been raising hogs for 20 years now. 

Marissa has requested a loan to buy pigs, pig feed, and vitamins.  These materials are very helpful in the hog-raising business. She can now sell quality pigs at a particular period of time. This will augment her income, thus enabling her to pay her loan and other expenses.

She hopes that she will be expanding her current business to be productive and at the same time open up a meat shop someday.

loans.use: to buy pigs, pig feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Rosa Orfilia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito De Mujeres Unidas se reúne en la ciudadela San Alejo de la bellísima ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida por las hermosas playas que recorren todas sus costas y que son muy visitadas por los turistas nacionales e internacionales.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 49 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y el menor de 15 años  que estudia en colegio, dos de sus hijos aun viven con ellos. Su marido es chofer.
Doña Rosa es una gran madre y esposa que se dedica al comercio, ella vende gas de uso doméstico para lo cual tiene un local en su casa, su marido también le ayuda cuando tiene que entregar a domicilio aunque la mayoría vende en su depósito, ella aprovecha que su marido trabaja en una distribuidora al por mayor de gas y le deja en su casa lo que ella necesita, lleva más de 25 años en este negocio y le va muy bien. 
Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar gas de uso doméstico. Lleva más de 15 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que les da la institución. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y en su vida personal.
texts.en:
The credit group "Mujeres Unidas" (United Women) meets in the San Alejo citadel, which is located in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi known for the beautiful beaches along all of its coasts that are frequently visited by national and international tourists.

In this place lives Rosa, who is 49 years old. She is in a common-law marriage and has three children, two adults and a 15 year old that is in school. Two of her children still live with her. Her husband is a driver.

Rosa is a great mother and wife, who makes a living in commerce. She sells gas for domestic use, for which she has a store in her house. Her husband helps her when she needs to make a delivery to a house, although she sells the majority at her store. She takes advantage of the fact that her husband works for a distributor of wholesale gas, and he leaves at home what she needs. She has been in this business for more than 25 years, and she does very well.

She is requesting a loan to buy gas for domestic use. She has been a member of the credit group for over 15 years, and she likes the help that the institution gives her. Her dream is to continue moving forward with her business and personal life.

loans.use: to buy gas for domestic use.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various merchandise ranging from salt, noodles, coffee, and canned goods, to soft drinks, powdered milk and toiletries. She is a 36-year-old married woman with two kids ages 5 and 2 respectively. Together with her family, she lives in Dulag, Leyte. Her husband is a security  guard. 

Marites is asking for a loan to buy assorted grocery items and frozen goods. These goods are essential to attracting more consumers to shop and purchase. She will be earning higher income, enabling her to pay for household expenses. 

In the future, Marites will manage her current livelihood to be successful for her to be able to attend to the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy assorted grocery items and frozen goods

loans.name: Nongheuangthong Group

texts.en:
Va is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. The silver nitrate-infused ceramic element removes and destroys bacteria and similar agents of waterborne diseases. Va's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in his village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  

Even though some people in the village, including Va’s, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Va and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Va's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter. Increasing time available for productive work also improves a family’s income and over all wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Somsaart Group

texts.en: Vadsana's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in Vadsana's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. Vadsana is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other waterborne diseases. Even though some people in the village, including Vadsana’s, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Vadsana and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal or wood and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Vadsana's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
Jose Alberto tiene 31 años de edad, es casado, vive con su cónyuge y su menor hijo en casa propia, en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería.

Jose Alberto se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros por mototaxi, con 07 años de experiencia en el rubro, sus actividades las realiza en el distrito y caseríos aledaños. El crédito será utilizado para invertir en arreglos y mantenimiento a su vehículo, con ello espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose Alberto is 31, married, and lives with his wife and young child in his own home in the Pucará district, Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the north of Peru. The locals work mainly in agriculture and livestock.
Jose Alberto provides a passenger mototaxi transportation service. He has 7 years' experience. He works in the local area and neighbouring hamlets. He will use this loan to invest in repairs and maintenance for his vehicle. He hopes to provide a better service, which will allow him to generate more income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Khamsawhang Group

texts.en:
Bounyong's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village, including Bounyong’s, are able to buy bottled water.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. Bounyong is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. 

Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other waterborne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Bounyong due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing  the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Divino Niño Jesús se destaca por su unión y por el trabajo en conjunto de cada una de ellas, son mujeres muy luchadoras y sacrificadas, que quieren ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo unido de todas.
Estas señoras  han mejorado sus ingresos, entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Maria, quien se dedica a la manicura, tiene una buena clientela que pudo tener gracias al buen trabajo que ha venido haciendo. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que quiere crecer y salir adelante en el microemprendimiento que tiene, ya que a través de el mantiene a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de esmaltes, limas, alicates, acetonas y demás. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Divino Niño Jesús Group stands out for its togetherness and for the work they all do as a group.  They're very determined and self-sacrificing women who want to help their families through the collaborative work of all of them.

These women have improved their income.  Among them is María, who earns a living as a manicurist.  She has good customers she acquired thanks to the good work she has been doing.  She's a very hardworking woman who wants to grow and make progress in her micro-enterprise, with which she supports her family.

María's requesting this loan to buy nail polish, files, clippers, nail polish remover, and other supplies.  She's grateful for this opportunity to be able to grow and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, files, clippers, nail polish remover, and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a snow cone machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cement and iron to build a room.
