Her family has been involved in agriculture for thirteen years. They have developed their farm on their own and take care of it with great care. The farm includes four greenhouses where tomato is cultivated. Anna’s husband sells the gathered harvest in local markets. 

She asks for this loan of USD 1500 to pay for a greenhouse renovation, a polyethylene cover for it and fuel for keeping it warm in the winter. Anna has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her farming business is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Anna has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a greenhouse renovation, a polyethylene cover for it and fuel for keeping it warm in the winter

loans.name: Twi Pain Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres (Mirna, Lucrecia,  y Beta) de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que trabajan día a día con el empeño de lograr el crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios de productos básicos; se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace aproximadamente año y medio para poder obtener préstamo en Pana Pana. El nombre de Twi Pain, que tomaron para su grupo solidario es en lengua mískita que significa Buena Hierba. 


Mirna: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer luchadora, tiene 50 años, madre soltera de tres hijos mayores de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos, desde hace 25 años se dedica a la venta de fritos, frijoles cosidos, chiverías. Está solicitando préstamo para comprar insumos para la elaboración de frito: filipitas, repollo, tomate, pollo aceite, entre otros productos. Ella sueña contener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
This lending group is made up of three members (Mirna, Lucrecia and Beta) of Miskita ethnicity, from the city of Bilwi in the county of Puerto Cabezas. These entrepreneurial women work every day with the desire to grow their small businesses. They organized as a group about a year and a half ago in order to get loans from Pana Pana. The name Twi Pain means "spearmint" in the Miskita language.

Mirna is the coordinator of the group. she is a hardworking woman, 50 years old, and a single mother of three grown children. Twenty-five years ago, with the goal of having her own source of income and helping out her children, she started selling fried foods, beans, and dairy products. She is asking for a loan to buy things to make fried foods: bananas, cabbage, tomatoes, chicken, oil and other things. Her dream is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make Nicaraguan fry-up: bananas, cabbage, tomato, chicken, oil and other things.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard lives in Aragats village with her son. She cultivates greens, cabbage and haricot in the greenhouse near her house. Alvard is a hardworking and nice woman who loves her work as a farmer. 

She asks for this loan of USD 2000 to purchase supplies for improving the greenhouse (polyethylene cover, pipes). She will be very thankful to all lenders for their support of her farm.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for improving the greenhouse (polyethylene cover, pipes)

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es:
María, de 26 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, y tiene 4 hijos.- Ella creció con su padre ya que su madre la abandonó, fue él quien le enseño acerca de la agricultura y la ganadería. 

María, se dedica a comercializar granos básicos (Maíz, frijol y frutas) en su vivienda y en el mercado de la ciudad, pero en el mercado obtiene mayores ventas de los productos que ofrece.  

María, necesita el crédito para comprar más granos básicos e incrementar la mercadería para su negocio, esto le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos, para el sustento de su familia.

María, sueña con construir una vivienda digna para sus hijos ya que actualmente es de barro.
texts.en:
María, who is 26 years old, studied until the ninth grade. She is in a relationship, and has 4 children. Since her mother abandoned her, she grew up with her father who taught her about agriculture and livestock. 

María sells basic staples (corn, beans, and fruit) in her home and in the city market, but in the market she makes better sales of the products she offers.

María needs the loan to buy basic staples and increase the amount of goods for her business, which would help increase her income, to support her family.

María dreams of building a house that is respectable for her children since their current one is made of clay.

loans.use: to buy more basic staples and increase the amount of goods for her business.

loans.name: Tan

texts.en: Tan is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. The silver nitrate-infused ceramic element removes and destroys bacteria and similar agents of water borne diseases. Tan's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in his village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  Even though some people in the village, including Tan, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Tan and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Tan's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; increasing time available for productive work and improving the family’s income and over all well-being.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 29 years old. He is married and together with his spouse has been blessed with three children, of 6, 3 and 2 years respectively. Daniel's spouse is a housewife, hence provides no additional income for the family.

Daniel offers electronic services, a business he has had for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 9,000.

Daniel has requested his third loan with VisionFund Kenya, for Kshs. 33,750, which he will use to buy electronic gadgets to be used in his electronics shop.

With the anticipated profits, Daniel will be able to repay his loan as well as gain more profits.

His hope and dream for the future is continue to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy electronic gadgets.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the Kshs 30,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat, so she can open a grocery. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat, so she can open a grocery.

loans.name: Rogelio Javier

texts.es:
Rogelio tiene 39 años, de estado civil conviviente. Su familia es unida, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge e hijos en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, con más de 01 año de experiencia en el negocio. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de cerdos y alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Rogelio espera aumentar la productividad de su negocio, mejorando la calidad de su producto y satisfaciendo los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, lo que tendrá un gran impacto en su nivel de ingresos y aumentará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rogelio is 39 years old, and is in a common-law relationship. His family is close, he owns a house where he lives with his partner and children in the district of Lagunas, in the province of Chiclayo, region Lambayeque, in the northern coast of Peru. The population of the district works primarily in agriculture and ranching. 
His occupation is the breeding and sale of pigs, he has more than 1 year of experience in the business. He has very good personal and work references in the area. The loan will be used to purchase a larger quantity of pigs and balanced feed for them. With this, Rogelio hopes to increase the productivity of his business, improving the quality of his product and satisfying the tastes and needs of his clients. This will have a great impact on his income level and will increase his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of pigs and balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Nasob Group

texts.en:
Done's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village, including Done’s, are able to buy bottled water.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    

Done is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter.  Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases.  The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Done due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water.  The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works for 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, es una persona soltera, vive con su madre quien depende de él, su fuente ingresos es la reventa de carne de cerdo, en ocasiones el compra el animal, realiza el destazo y luego sale a vender la carne en los pueblos aledaños, no tiene competencia en la zona lo que le da una ventaja.
Comprará un cerdo y dos estantes metálicos en los que exhibirá los tipos de carne que tiene a la venta, está decisión la ha tomado esperando tener como resultado mejor imagen de su negocio, ofrecer un buen servicio, tener mayores ventas y ganancias.
Sus objetivos son ampliar su negocio y tener un vehículo propio para desempeñar sus actividades en menor tiempo.
texts.en:
José is single and lives with his mother who is dependent on him. His source of income is pork meat sales, sometimes buying the animal, cutting it up and then selling the meat in neighboring towns. To his advantage, he doesn't have any competition. 

He will buy a pig and two metal shelves in which he will display the kinds of meat he has for sale. He made this decision hoping as a result to have a better image for his business, offer better service, and create more sales and income. His objectives are to expand his business and to have his own vehicle to carry out his activities in less time.

loans.use: to buy a pig and two metal shelves in which he will display the kinds of meat he has for sale.

loans.name: Lala

texts.en:
Lala is from Dimitrov village where she lives with her son Khachatur.

Lala is a farmer with 20 years of experience. She is mainly involved in horticulture. The gathered harvest Lala sells in local markets, and with it she gathers income for her family.

Because it is very difficult for women to take care of big farms alone (her son is a migrant worker, and most of the time is not in the country), Lala needs support. She asks lenders to support her with this loan, helping her to purchase fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation.

Lala has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her farming business is successful and because she is able to make monthly payments, Lala has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation.

loans.name: Kadide

texts.en:
Kadide is a married woman and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and water bills.

For the past three years, she has operated a timber selling business from home, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality as a major challenge to her business. She dreams of establishing a poultry business.

With the Kshs 50,000 loan she wants to purchase more chicken for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken for resale

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en: San’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. San makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor and factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Los Jovenes Group

texts.es: A como su nombre este grupo solidario lo integran tres jóvenes emprendedores, coordinado por Denis quien tiene la edad de 24 años, soltero y propietario de un taller de carpintería desde hace cuatro años, es el cuarto ciclo que solicita el financiamiento en ADIM, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de madera (cedro macho) con los créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar la producción pues las ganancias las ha reinvertido y comprado herramientas que le permiten ofrecer un producto de calidad además ha aumentado la producción y por ende han mejorar sus ingresos. El resto de los integrantes son, Fabiola de 22 años de edad dedicada a la comercialización de ropa y calzado en su comunidad y Huberne de 29 años de edad comerciante de perecederos.
texts.en:
As the name suggests, this communal bank is made up of three enterprising young people.  Denis, 24, is the coordinator.  He's single and has owned a furniture shop for four years.

He's requesting the current loan to buy wood (cedro macho).  This is his fourth loan cycle with ADIM.  With the previous loans he has managed to increase his production and, as a result, improve his income.  Also, he has reinvested his profits and bought tools that allow him to sell a quality product.

The other members are Fabiola, 22, who earns a living selling clothing and footwear in her community, and Huberne, 29, who sells perishable goods.

loans.use: to buy wood (cedro macho)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nang's Group

texts.en: Nang’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Nang makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nger's Group

texts.en: Nger’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Nger makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kaenfkabaoneua Group

texts.en: Bounthavee is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. The silver nitrate-infused ceramic element removes and destroys bacteria and similar agents of water borne diseases. Bounthavee's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in his village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. Even though some people in the village, including Bounthavee’s, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Bounthavee and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Bounthavee's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; increasing time available for productive work thereby improving a family’s income and over-all well-being.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Kaengkabaotai Group

texts.en: Luexai's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in Luexai's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. Luexai is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. Even though some people in the village, including Luexai’s, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Luexai and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal or wood and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Luexai's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en: Mao’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. Mao makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each man and woman to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín, se dedica a vender la fruta de temporada para obtener ingresos, en esta época esta ofreciendo a sus clientes melones, vende por las mañanas todos los días en una misma zona, Vive en compañía de sus dos hijos los cuales depende económicamente él.
El crédito lo utilizará para comprar melones y sandías al por mayor, con la inversión aprovechara el buen precio del producto y obtendrá mejores ganancias vendiendo al menudeo, espera obtener mejores ganancias para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Sus ambiciones son tener una buena capacidad de pago y dar a sus hijos mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Efraín sells seasonal fruits for his income. This season he is offering his customers melons, and sells every morning in the same area. He lives with his two sons who depend on him financially. He will use the loan to buy melons and watermelons wholesale. With the investment he will make the most of the good price of the product and will earn more selling at retail. He hopes to earn more to fulfill his obligations. His ambitions are to have a better ability to pay for and give his sons a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy melons and watermelons wholesale, to make the most of the good price of the product with the investment.

loans.name: Vatt's Group

texts.en: Vatt’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Vatt makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios earns a living by engaging in making and selling puto (rice cake). She is a 50-year-old married woman from Dulag, Leyte with seven children. Two of her children are still attending school. To have an additional source of income, she engages in selling eggs. It has been two years now since she engaged in that kind of business.

She is asking for a loan to purchase additional eggs to resell and supplies for vending like rice flour, sugar, leavening agents and flavoring. These ingredients will be used in making rice cakes, and she will sell them in her local community. It will also help sell more eggs as supplemental income for her family.

In the future she dreams of handling her business properly to improve her livelihood, to have a stable source of income and also to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional eggs to resell and supplies for vending like rice flour, sugar, leavening agents and flavoring.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Vothy's Group

texts.en: Vothy’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. Vothy makes a living cultivating rice and making jars and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Khem's Groupmen

texts.en: Khem’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. Khem makes a living cultivating rice and making jars to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sothea's Group

texts.en: Sothea’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh in Cambodia. Sothea makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Muong Phang 16 Group

texts.en:
Hoa, 46, is a Thai ethnic lady who is a widow and lives with her two sons, a daughter-in-law and two grandchildren in an old Thai traditional house. They rely mainly on agricultural production for a living with plenty of activities, such as cultivating rice, raising pigs, chickens and breeding fish.

Hoa is very hardworking and she has been a farmer since she was a very little girl, so she has plenty of experience in farming and animal husbandry. To increase production and stabilize the family's income, she has taken a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program to have enough capital for her investment in agricultural production as well as gain more knowledge from training and counseling from the Program. This is the fourth time she has received a loan from the Program and she will use it to buy young fish. She hopes that her investment in fish farming will go well and she will gain a high profit like the previous investment.

Hoa has not been confident because she is illiterate, so she has always wanted her sons and grandchildren to have the best education. She dreams her grandchildren will be able to study in good colleges and have good jobs with bright futures, so that they could help the family escape from poverty. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy young fish

loans.name: Pablo Pastor

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 41 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su madre en una casa de material rústico en el distrito de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica principalmente al comercio y crianza de ganado menor.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de reparación de motos como mecánico, con más de 6 años de experiencia en el rubro. Cuentas con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de materiales como cemento, calaminas, madera, pintura, entre otros, para la ampliación y mejoramiento de su vivienda. Esto le permitirá contar con unas mejores condiciones en su vivienda, lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su calidad de vida y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Pablo is 41 years old, is single, and lives with his mother in a house made of rustic material in the district of Morropón, in the region of Piura, in the northern coast of Peru. The population of the district works primarily in retail and small livestock. 
His occupation is motorcycle repair services as a mechanic, with more than 6 years of experience in the matter. He has very good personal and work references in the area. The loan will be used for the purchase of materials, such as cement, corrugated iron, wood, paint, among others, for the expansion and improvement of his house. This will allow him to have better life conditions in his home, which will have a positive impact in his quality of life, and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials, such as cement, corrugated iron, wood, paint, among others, for the expansion and improvement of his home.

loans.name: Mujeres Maravillas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Maravillas es un grupo nuevo, que se formo con la unión de 18 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras de la ciudad de Lambaré, todas y cada una de ellas quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Herenia es parte de este grupo, una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, quien se dedica al comercio, vende prendas y cosméticos, que siempre tiene muy buena variedad, lo cual gusta mucho a sus clientes. Quiere poder capacitarse para poder seguir creciendo y saliendo adelante en todo lo que hace. Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas varias y también de cosméticos para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Maravillas" [Wonder Women] communal bank is a new group. It is made up of 18 very hardworking women from the city of Lambaré. Each one of them wants to improve their families' living conditions.

Herencia is part of this group. She is a very hardworking woman who works in commerce. She sells clothing and cosmetics. She always has very good variety, which her clients really like. She would like to get training so she can continue growing and getting ahead in all that she does. She is requesting this loan to buy a variety of clothing and costmetics so she can continue making her sales as she is currently doing.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing and costmetics for sale.

loans.name: Gregoria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gregoria, se dedica a vender tortillas y además posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, actividades que aprendió a desempeñar dentro de su familia y fundo su propio negocio hace 2 años, lo atiende de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, vive con su familia conformada por su esposo y sus hijos, todos le colaboran en el negocio.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar maíz, cal y leña  al por mayoreo para elaborar la venta de tortillas, fortalecer su negocio, aumentará la productividad y cubrirá las necesidades de sus clientes, espera incrementar sus ganancias para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Gregoria sueña con tener una mejor situación económica y dar un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Georgia sells tortillas and also has a store selling basic food products, which are activities she learned to do in her family. 

She set up her own business two years ago which she tends from seven in the morning until five in the evening. She lives her husband and two children all of whom work with her in the business. 

She will use the loan to buy what her customers need, hoping to increase her income in order to fulfill her responsibilities. 

Georgia dreams of having a better financial situation and giving her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, and firewood wholesale in order to prepare tortillas for sale.

loans.name: Muong Phang 14 Group

texts.en:
Tien, 32, is from a Thai ethnic group and lives with her husband's family in an old Thai traditional house. She has two daughters 7 and 13 years old and they both attend school fully. Tien works very hard at agricultural production to support the crowded family with plenty of activities such as cultivating rice and raising fish, pigs, chickens and musk ducks. She has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program to buy young fish to increase production and improve income for the family. She hopes that with the financial and technical support of the Program, her investment will be prosperous and she could overcome the difficulties ahead.

Tien dreams her family will have a more stable life and her children will study in good colleges, then get good jobs and change the current circumstance to a brighter future. In the picture, she wears a Thai ethnic traditional costume and stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy young fish to increase production

loans.name: Elia Milagro

texts.es:
Elia, de 39 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, se acompañó hace 10 años, su compañero de vida trabaja como jardinero en un hospital y tienen 2 hijos.

Elia, se dedica a realizar trabajos de agricultura, su madre le enseño a trabajar en la tierra, ella aprendió bien el manejo de estas actividades, las cuales son las que durante todo el año, le permiten tener los granos básicos para el consumo y hasta para vender.-  El lugar donde trabaja está a dos kilómetros de su casa y lo dedica seis horas diarias, algunas veces requiere de contratas trabajadores que le ayuden con los cultivos. 

El préstamo lo utilizará para pagar el alquiler de 21,000 metros cuadrados de terreno y para comprar 12 sacos de fertilizantes; ella necesita cancelar pronto porque si no lo hace, los dueños se lo alquilan a otra persona y los sacos de fertilizantes los a conseguido a buen precio, es por eso que quiere aprovechar de comprarlo pronto, porque después los puede encontrar más caros. 

El sueño de Elia es, ayudar a su primer hijo para que estudie, ya que él quiere ser abogado, es por eso que quiere tener las condiciones necesarias, para poder ayudarlo.
texts.en:
Elia, 39, studied up to high school.  She and her life partner have been together for 10 years.  He works as a gardener in a hospital and they have two children.

She earns a living doing agricultural jobs.  Her mother taught her to work the land and she learned to handle those tasks well, and they allow her to have basic grains for consumption and even to sell throughout the entire year.  The place she works is two kilometers from her house, and she devotes six hours a day to it.  Sometimes she has to hire workers to help her with the crops.

She's going to use the loan to pay the rent on 21,000 square meters of land and to buy 12 bags of fertilizer.  She needs to pay soon because the owners will rent it to someone else if she doesn't.  She found the fertilizer at a good price, so she wants to buy it soon, because later it might be more expensive.

Elia's dream is to help her oldest child go to school, because he wants to be a lawyer.  That's why she wants to have the conditions she needs to be able to help him.

loans.use: to pay the rent on 21,000 square meters of land and to buy 12 bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Rosa Mística está en su ciclo número 8 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación donde 
una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lucrecia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha ido superando su situación de pobreza, a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo. Lucrecia se dedica a vender ropas en general y también platería, es una persona muy sacrificada que quiere seguir ayudando a su familia, es por eso que no se cansa de trabajar.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas varias para poder surtirse, como también de platerías varias. Está contenta por formar parte de este unido grupo.
texts.en:
The "Rosa Mística" communal loan group is in it's 8th loan cycle of the women's committee program, where all of the participants work and help each other to get ahead. They are particpating in the poverty elimination survey, where one of the the members is Lucrecia. In her last survey, she showed a level of poverty at level three, which means she has been overcoming her situation of poverty, through continuous effort and work. Lucrecia sells clothing and als silver jewelry. She is a very self-sacrificing person who wants to continue helping her family. This is why she never tires of working.

She is requesting the loan to buy a variety of clothing so she can stock up, also a variety of silver jewelry. She is glad to be a part of this close-knit group.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en: Shameem is a 50-year-old married woman. She has been involved in the business of selling spreads, blankets and cloth material. She purchases a variety of these items at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Shameem has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR. She wants to buy a new collection in different colors and designs for her customers to get a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a new collection in different colors and designs for her customers to get a boost in her earnings

loans.name: San Ramon 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Ramon 2 está en su 1º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres emprendedoras, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, por un bienestar propio y para las de su familia y con la ayuda que cada una de las señoras se brindan a que puedan salir adelante. 
Zulma es parte de este grupo, una persona muy humilde y por sobre todo trabajadora que con sacrificio ha ido saliendo adelante y quiere poder seguir creciendo en su micronegocio, el cual es la venta de prendas, comenta que es muy sacrificado su trabajo, pero que lo hace para poder ayudar a su familia y seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, y así poder comprar prendas variadas y seguir luchando día a día.
texts.en:
The "San Ramon 2" communal bank is in its first loan cycle in the entreprenurial women's committee program, where all of the participants work together to get ahead. For their own wellbeing, and that of their families, and with the help of each of the women, they pledge to each other that they will get ahead. 

Zulma is part of this group. She is of very humble circumstances and extremely hardworking. With much sacrifice she has been getting ahead and she wants to continue growing in her small business, which is clothing sales. She explains that she makes a lot of sacrifices for her work, but she does it in order to help her family and loved ones.

She is requesting the loan so she can continue with her sales as she is doing now. In this way, she will be able to buy a variety of clothing and continue working hard from day to day.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing items for sale.

loans.name: Con Un Proposito Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Con un Proposito, está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras (Brenda, Veira Donia y Katherine Yessenia), viven en la ciudad de Bilwi; se unieron hace 8 meses con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para poder tener acceso a préstamos en Pana Pana, que les permitiera incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar poco a poco las condiciones de vida de sus familias.

Brenda: Es la Coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer amable, originaria de Waspam Rio Coco, llegó a vivir a Bilwi en el período que evacuaron a toda la población del Río Coco en los años 80.  Tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Su esposo compra y vende madera. Desde hace 13 años ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en un tramo que alquila en el mercado municipal, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar y de los estudios de sus hijos. Gracias a los créditos anteriores que Pana Pana le ha brindado, ha podido diversificar los productos de su negocio, ahora además de ropa usada también vende calzado nuevo y ropa interior. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua: paca mixta para hombres y mujeres, ropa interior y en Masaya comprar calzado para damas, caballeros y niños.  Sueña con tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "Con un Proposito Group" ["Group With a Purpose"] is made up of three entrepreneurial women (Brenda, Veira Donia and Katherine Yessenia) who live in the city of Bilwi. They joined together eight months ago for the purpose of working together to be able to have access to loans at Pana Pana, which allow them to increase the inventory of their small businesses, and better their earnings, thereby improving conditions for their families' lives little by little.

Brenda, the coordinator of the group, is a friendly woman originally from Wapsam Rio Coco. She came to live in Bilwi when they evacuated the entire population of Río Coco in the 1980's. 

She is 34 years old, married, and has two school-age children. Her husband buys and sells wood. Since she was 13 years old she has been selling used clothing in a space she rents in the municipal market. She earns her own income this way and contributes to home expenses and her children's education. 

Thanks to the previous loans that Pana Pana provided her, she has been able to diversify the products in her business. In addition to used clothing she now also sells new shoes and undergarments. 

She is requesting financing to buy various types of men's and women's clothing in bulk in Managua, and to buy footwear for ladies, men and children in Masaya. She dreams of having a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy various types of men's and women's clothing in bulk in Managua; to buy footwear for ladies, men and children in Masaya.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El Sr. Emilio proviene de una familia humilde de una de las compañía de Carapeguá, es casado, comenta que desde muy joven se dedicó a la agricultura, de a poco fue comprando animales con el fruto de su trabajo, mas adelante  decidió  dedicarse al macate (venta en forma ambulante) que hasta hoy día lo sigue realizando por zonas lejanas.
El en vista a querer seguir creciendo y luchando pide este préstamo, para poder invertirlo en la compra de sobrecamas, hamacas, sábanas, etc., de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Emilio is from a family of humble circumstances in one of the communities of Carapeguá. He is married. He explains that from the time he was very young, he worked in agriculture. Over time, he has purchased animals with the earnings from his work. Eventually, he decided to work as a street salesman, which he continues doing, working in far-away areas.

In light of the fact that he wants to continue growing and working hard, he is requesting a loan. It will be for the purchase of blankets, hammocks, sheets, etc. so that he can continue with his sales.

loans.use: to buy blankets, hammocks, sheets, etc.

loans.name: Mbinkinding's Group

texts.fr:
Mise en place le jour de son inauguration, les différents groupes de ce banc villageois sont composés de femmes très dynamiques dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Elles sont dans leur majorité dans le petit commerce qui est accompagné de l’agriculture sous pluie depuis plusieurs années. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et partagent des liens de solidarité très solides.
 
Madame Mbinkinding (debout à l’extrême droit avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle mariée, âgée de 27, c’est une femme très active. Elle est vendeuse de légumes frais qu’elle s’approvisionne par carton ou panier au marché de la commune pour la revente par détail dans son village et les environs. Elle a une bonne connaissance de l’activité et renouvelle sa commande pratiquement chaque semaine.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter différents légumes frais pour une valeur de 125 000 Fr CFA pour la revente.


En plus de renforcer son activité, les bénéfices lui permettront d’augmenter son épargne et d’assister son mari dans le foyer.

NB : la membre en médaillon est venue après la prise de vue de son groupe.
texts.en:
Set up on the day of its inauguration, the different groups of this "banc villageois" loan association consist of women who are highly dynamic in their income-generating activities. Most have been running small businesses along with rain-fed agriculture for many years. They all live in the same village and share very strong solidarity ties.
 
Mrs Mbinkinding (standing at the far right with one hand raised), is the group's featured borrower. She is married, 27 years old, and is a very active woman.

She sells fresh vegetables she buys by the box or basket at the local market, for retail sales in the village and its surrounding area. She has a good knowledge of the business and resupplies almost every week.

She intends to use the new loan to buy 125,000 CFA francs' worth of various fresh vegetables, for resale. In addition to strengthening her business the profits will enable her to increase her savings and assist her husband at home.

Note: the member shown in the insert came after the group picture was taken.

loans.use: buy 125,000 CFA francs' worth of various fresh vegetables, for resale.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura, her husband and two daughters live in Geghakert village, Armavir region. 

Laura has been involved in farming for many years. She specializes in horticulture. On her farm, she owns a greenhouse and arable land where haricot, cabbage, potato and greens are cultivated. 

The greenhouse that Laura owns is old and needs some improvements to be done on it. That’s the reason Laura asked for this loan. She hopes to renovate the greenhouse, and purchase pipes, a polyethylene cover for it and also some potato seeds (200 kgs).

loans.use: to renovate the greenhouse and purchase pipes, a polyethylene cover for it and some potato seeds (200 kgs).

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a married woman with one child who attends school and is under her care. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For over three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan of 40,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a bale of kids wear clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of kids wear clothes for resale

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity but nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over 10 years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is married and has two sons. She has her own business. Rita has been growing vegetables in greenhouses for eight years. She has two big greenhouses. Rita is a hardworking and open person, but she has had some difficulties in her life. She was divorced, having two small sons, and had to leave to Italy and work there for eight years. Then she returned to Ukraine and began her business. Rita wants to develop her business further and build four more greenhouses.

Rita is asking for a loan of 15,000 UAH to buy seeds and install a heating system in her greenhouses. This loan will help her to get a big harvest in the upcoming season.

loans.use: to buy seeds and install a heating system in her greenhouses.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married and has one child. Svetlana has her own business. She has been selling women's clothes at the market for nine years. She rents a nice place at the central market and brings in clothes from Turkey. She has a big assortment of good-quality clothes. Svetlana is a smart and responsible person and she wants to have her own shop in the future.

Svetlana is asking for a loan of 10,000 UAH to buy women's clothes for the winter season. This loan will help her to get a bigger income during this holiday season.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for the winter season.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married and has two sons. She lives in a new house with her family. Ludmila is a responsible and hardworking person. Now she is experiencing difficulties in her life. Her mother is sick and she needs to have surgery. Ludmila doesn't need money to support her financially - she just needs to be beside her mother to take care of her.

Ludmila is asking for a loan of 30,000 UAH to do some repairs to her new house. She wants to fix the bathroom and install a new plumbing system. The loan will help to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to fix the bathroom and install a new plumbing system to improve living conditions for her family.

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
Raisa sells mens clothes at the market. She has a lot of experience working in this area. Raisa is a regular client of Kiva and she is very thankful to have an opportunity to get loans. 

This time Raisa is asking for a loan of 10,000 UAH to buy mens clothes for the winter season. This loan will help her to arrange the assortment of clothes and get a bigger income.

loans.use: to purchase goods wholesale for the winter season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Biti

texts.en:
Biti is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan of 20,000 Kes she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is a widow and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Erlinda has requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Russylen

texts.en: Russylen is 32 years old and married with two children. One child is in school, and Russylen works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. Russylen has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Fe is 42 years old and her two children are both in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Fe has requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 36 years old and married with four children who are in school, Janeth works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc.

Janeth has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for two years now. Cynthia has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 56 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell.

Celia has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 56 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. Cristita works very hard to provide for them. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and has requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Cristita has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is 28 years old, married and has one child who is in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Aidah has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Aidah has been farming rice for six years now, and has borrowed 25 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Aidah would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Fely has been in this business for eight years now. She has requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fishing supplies and maintenance for her fishing boat. In the future, Fely would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing supplies and maintenance for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Jemina

texts.en:
Jemina is 44 years old and married with one child in school. Jemina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business selling Avon products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of Avon products to sell.

Jemina has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, Jemina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of Avon products to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 38 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Araceli has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from buy-and-sell charcoal. Araceli aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwaka operates a vegetable selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a married woman staying together with her husband and three children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past 17 years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anya

texts.en:
Here is Anya from Deghdzut village. She keeps an orchard where a big variety of fruit is grown (peaches, apricots, cherries, plums, strawberries, grapes and pears). Anya gets a good harvest in the season and is a very successful farmer in the village. She also owns a refrigerator, where for the winter season she keeps fruit. Anya’s husband helps her with the orchard very much. His task is to sell the gathered harvest in the market. Anya is a mother of two grown up sons who also help their mother with farming. 

To be able to renovate the greenhouse and start the cultivation of vegetables, Anya asks for this loan. She also wants to purchase steers and forage and start cattle breeding as well. 

Anya hopes that lenders will help her dream come true: to have a profitable and sustainable farm.

loans.use: to renovate the greenhouse and start the cultivation of vegetables and to purchase steers and forage and start cattle breeding as well

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is married and has children in school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a food vending business which sells to market dwellers and passersby. Luvuno cites seasonality to be her major challenge.  She dreams of expanding and establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 loan she wants to purchase cooking fat, rice, beans, and wheat flour for use in her food cooking business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat, rice, beans, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa is 51 years old, married, and had five grown-up children. Her spouse provides motorcycle transport services within their village. Felisa wanted to help her husband by getting a loan. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy gasoline and crude oil for maintenance of the motorcycle. This will ensure a safe travel to all their passengers. Felisa and her husband will continue improving their income so they can save funds for the family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and crude oil for maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena works hard to support her family. She is single and has a buy and sell root crops business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of root crops to sell.

Ma. Elena has been in this business for ten years now.

In the future, Ma. Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of root crops to sell

loans.name: Union Y Fuerza Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Unión y Fuerza" se encuentra en una comunidad mazahua llena de colores y muchas tradiciones, los integrantes se sienten muy contentos de pertenecer a un lugar así, donde los habitantes se apoyan mutuamente.

Doña Alicia es una mujer alegre y trabajadora se desenvuelve muy bien con las personas que la rodean, ella tiene 31 años y vive en unión libre con el señor Ernesto quien trabaja en la construcción de casas. Juntos han formado una familia con tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos se encuentran estudiando el preescolar y el mayor su educación primaria.

Hace siete años Alicia abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, en ella surgió la idea de tener un negocio porque de alguna manera quería ayudar con los gastos de su hogar y vivir cerca de la calle más transitada de su comunidad resultaba ser un beneficio extra para el tipo de actividad. Para tener el capital suficiente, Alicia comenzó a vender elotes preparados y esquites afuera de su casa en una pequeña mesita donde también colocaba una lona para cubrirse del sol. Durante seis meses ahorró todas sus ganancias que utilizó para comprar dulces y refrescos. Poco a poco las ganancias fueron aumentando y fue cuando formalmente inició la tienda de abarrotes. 

Los préstamos de VisionFund le han permitido conservar su negocio al seguir surtiendo su mercancía como pan, huevo, leche, azúcar, productos lácteos, detergentes, etc. Doña Alicia está muy contenta y agradecida con la oportunidad y el apoyo que recibe a través de los préstamos. Su sueño es poder hacer crecer más su negocio para seguir ayudando con los gastos del hogar y sobretodo con los gastos de educación de sus hijos porque quiere verlos realizados profesionalmente.

Los demás integrantes del grupo al igual que Doña Alicia están muy agradecidos con VisionFund y KIVA porque desde hace ya varios años han estado solicitando préstamo para sus negocios. Don Severiano, Irma y Don José Juan invierten en la cria y engorda de borregos, negocio que les ayuda a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

*La fotografía fue capturada cerca de la casa de Don Severiano y con sus animalitos. Alicia es quien carga en su espalda a un pequeño con ayuda de su reboso rosa*
texts.en:
The group “Unión y Fuerza” (Unity and Strength) is found in a Mazahua community filled with colors and many traditions. The members are pleased to belong to a place where the residents help one another.

Doña Alicia is a cheerful and hardworking woman who gets along well with the people around her. She is 31 years old and in a common-law relationship with Sr. Ernesto, who works by building houses. Together they have formed their family that includes three children, two of whom are studying in preschool. The oldest child is in elementary school.

Seven years ago, Alicia opened a small grocery store. She came up with the idea to have a business because she wanted to have some way of helping with the household expenses. Since she lives near one of the busiest streets in her community, she thought it would be an extra benefit to have this type of business. In order to have enough capital, Alicia began selling corn on the cob and corn salad outside of her house from a small table that was covered by a tarp so that she could protect herself from the sun. Over a period of six months, she saved all of her earnings and used the money to buy sweets and soft drinks. Her earnings gradually increased and she formally started her grocery store.

The loans from VisionFund have allowed her to keep her business stocked with merchandise such as bread, eggs, milk, sugar, dairy products, detergents, and other products. Doña Alicia is very pleased and appreciative of the opportunity and the support she has received through the loans. Her dream is to grow her business even more so that she can continue contributing to the household expenses and, most importantly, to her children’s educational expenses because she wants to see them become professionals.

The other members of the group, just like Doña Alicia, are extremely grateful to VisionFund and Kiva because of the loans they requested for their businesses over the course of several years. Don Severiano, Irma, and Don José will invest in the raising and fattening of sheep. This business helps them to improve their quality of life and that of their families.

*The photograph was taken near Don Severiano’s house with his animals. Alicia is seen carrying her young child on her back with the help of her pink shawl.

loans.use: to buy bread, eggs, milk, sugar, dairy products, detergents, and other products.

location.town: Tres Estrellas, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Manifa's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été mis en place le 18 Octobre 2012 et porte le nom du village qui l’abrite. Il regroupe en son sein des femmes qui en plus des liens de solidarité et parental qui les unies, viennent d’avoir quatre cycles qui ont soudé d’avantage ces liens. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce accompagné de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Manifa (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 67 ans et mère d’un garçon. Elle s’active dans la vente de légume frais (oseil…) et divers autres condiments qu’elle achète à l’occasion de la tenue du marché hebdomadaire pour la revente au détail dans le village.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter deux paniers d’aubergine, deux seaux de pâte d’arachide à 24 000 F CFA, un bidon d’huile raffinée de 20 litres à 15 000 F CFA pour la revente au village.

Ses  bénéfices, lui servent à renforcer son épargne et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille sur le plan de la nourriture et sanitaire.
texts.en:
The group was established October 18, 2012 and bears the name of the village. It includes women who, united by solidarity and parental ties, have gone through four loan cycles reinforcing those links. Their main activity is small trade supplemented by rain-fed agriculture.

Mrs Manifa (standing on the far right raising her hand), is the group's featured borrower. She is married, 67 years old, and mother of a boy. She is active in selling fresh vegetables (sorrel,...) and other condiments that she buys at the weekly market, for retail sales in the village.

She intends to use the new loan to buy two baskets of eggplants, two buckets of groundnut paste for 24,000 CFA francs, one 20-liter container of culinary oil for 15,000 CFA francs, for resale in the village.

Her profits will serve to bolster her savings and improve her family's living conditions, in terms of food and health.

loans.use: buy two baskets of eggplants, two buckets of groundnut paste for 24,000 CFA francs, one 20-liter container of culinary oil for 15,000 CFA francs, for resale in the village.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a hog raiser and manages it well in order to achieve a better income from selling hogs. 

Amalia wants to ensure the good health of the hogs with enough sustenance. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and medicines for the hogs. 

She will supervise her hog raising business in order to make it profitable. Additional profits gained will be kept for family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for hogs

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. She is 58 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, rice, etc.

Lorna has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, rice, etc

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en:
Flordelisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Flordelisa has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future, Flordelisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Floredel

texts.en:
Floredel is 29 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Floredel has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
Florinda is 66 years old and widowed with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, soft drinks, chips, bread, etc.

Florinda has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from buy and sell frozen products and motorcycle transport.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Florinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, soft drinks, chips, bread, etc

loans.name: Almaton

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Almaton works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  Almaton is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Almaton has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a married woman. She owns a house that as neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to local neighbours.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, and sugar to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is a married woman and has children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the loan, she is requesting of Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima is a married woman. She lives in a house that has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting of Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale so that she can get a profit and build her house. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Luz Neida

texts.es: Luz, una intratable, curiosa, creativa, responsable mujer de 35 años de edad que gracias a s u negocio de confección directa puede generar el sustento para su hogar, ya que no tiene hijos ni pareja, vela por el cuidado de sus familiares sanguíneos y proyecta su negocio para vender cantidades de prendas pues tiene fe en lo que hace, la falta de capital para invertir en maquinaria e insumos, ha sido el problema en común pero ahora que puede solicitar un crédito con una entidad que confiara en ella lo hará pues necesita de urgencia una maquina fileteadora, telas e hilos, para sacar adelante sus proyectos
texts.en: Luz, 35 years old, and a curious, responsible and creative woman is able, thanks to her dressmaking business, to generate an income for her household. She does not have a partner or children but looks after other relatives. At her business she plans to sell large quantities of clothing items as she has faith in her work. Luz, however, needs capital to invest in a sewing machine and supplies. This has been a problem but now she is applying for a loan from an organisation who has confidence in her. Luz urgently needs an overlock sewing machine, material and thread in order to move forward with her plans.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine, threads and material.

loans.name: Thủy

texts.en:
Thủy operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.

Thủy is 38 years old and married with two children. Thủy lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thủy has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thủy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Thủy faces in her life is not having money to build a toilet .She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Thủy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Miên

texts.en:
Mrs. Miên operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.

Miên is 33 years old and married with two children. She lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Miên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Miên has been involved in this business for four years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Miên hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en:
Mrs. Lanh operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.

Lanh is 32 years old and married with two children. Lanh lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. This is Lanh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lanh has been involved in this business for five years.

The main hardship that Lanh faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Lanh hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 53 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, soft drinks, etc.

Rosie has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Rosie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, and soft drinks

loans.name: Bưởi

texts.en:
Mrs. Bưởi operates a food stall/restaurant selling soup.

Bưởi is 45 years old and married with two children. Bưởi lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Bưởi's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Bưởi has been involved in this business for five years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Bưởi hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Thọ

texts.en:
Mrs. Thọ operates a food stall/restaurant selling soup.

Thọ is 45 years old and married with three children. She lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thọ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.Thọ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thọ hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Hường

texts.en:
Mrs. Hường operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.

Hường is 45 years old and married with three children. Hường lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hường's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hường has been involved in this business for 10 years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hường hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Ái

texts.en:
Mrs. Ái has a retail business selling clothes.

Ái is 50 years old and married with three children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Ái's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Ái has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Ái faces in her life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Ái hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Nelber Augusto

texts.es:
Neiber es un solitario tendero que trabaja día a día para generar su propio sustento, a sus 45 años de edad su única compañía es su tienda y en ella encuentra los mejores momentos de esparcimiento y de goce junto con sus vecinos, oferta productos de la canasta familiar como lo son granos, abarrotes, refrescos, lácteos etc., pero como sabe que una tienda tiene un volumen de ventas altos y de constante movimiento necesitara de suficiente surtido para abastecer a sus cliente.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de productos refrigerados, refrescos, dulces, frituras, y granos.
texts.en:
