Neiber is living alone. He is a shopkeeper who works every day to provide for his own sustenance. At 45 years of age, his only companion is his store, and in his store he finds the best moments of relaxation and enjoyment together with his neighbors.

He offers basic goods like grains, groceries, soft drinks, dairy products, etc., but as he knows that a store needs a high turnover and a constant movement of goods, he needs sufficient stocks to supply his customers.

He is asking for a loan to buy frozen products, soft drinks, sweets, fried food, and grains.

loans.use: to buy a supply of frozen products, soft drinks, sweets, fried food, and grains.

loans.name: Toàn

texts.en:
Mrs. Toàn operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.

Toàn is 40 years old and married with two children. Toàn lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Toàn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Toàn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Toàn faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Toàn hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Daisy Yuliana

texts.es: Un sueño alimento el espíritu de Daisy una empresaria que sabe que es recorrer la calle, puerta a puerta acercándose a los clientes buscando vender algunos de sus productos, ella oferta ropa para hombre y dama y lo hace solo por alcanzar el sueño de tener una vivienda propia para vivir junto con su hija de 3 meses que crezca y viva en una vivienda que llegue del esfuerzoe de Daisy por tal razón ella trabajara las horas que sean necesarias para lograr este objetivo y solicita tu ayuda para que le prestes un poco de capital que ella invertirá en la compra de ropa en cantidades para sacar mejor rentabilidad en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Daisy has a dream, and this dream feeds her entrepreneurial spirit. She sells in the street, and is going from door to door to approach customers who want to buy some of her products.

She sells clothing for men and women, and does this only to make her dream come true: to have her own home where she wants to live with her daughter, who is 3 months old. She wants her daughter to grow up and to live in a house which Daisy earned with her efforts. For this reason, she will work as long as necessary, to reach this goal.

She is asking for your help to lend some money, which she will invest in the purchase of clothing in great quantities, in order to get better returns on her sales.

loans.use: to buy a supply of clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Luyến

texts.en:
Mrs. Luyến works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

Luyến is 54 years old and married with two children. Luyến lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Luyến's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Luyến has been involved in this business for less than a year.

The main hardship that Luyến faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Luyến hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta, opta por un nuevo préstamo para incrementar su inventario y obtener mejores ganancias, comprará 5 qq de concentrado para alimentar cerdos y pagará mozos para recolectar una manzana cosechada de maicillo.
La ayuda que tuvo con el crédito anterior le ha permitido seguir vendiendo antojitos y manteniendo la crianza de cerdos y pollos, dice tener un negocio más rentable, las condiciones de vida son más favorables y cancelado con buena calificación su crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Modesta is applying for a new loan to increase her inventory and earn more profit.  She will buy 5 quintals of animal feed concentrate for her pigs and hire workers to harvest the millet crop.

The help received through the previous loan allowed her to sell snacks and continue raising her pigs and chickens.  She says her business is more profitable and her lifestyle is more positive.  She paid back her previous loan and has a good credit record.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for her pigs and hire workers to harvest her millet crop.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, es sastre, está soltero, vive con un hijo, el cual está en edad escolar, no tiene ayuda del extranjero; el oficio lo aprendió desde hace 20 años, cuando adquirió la experiencia necesaria decidió fundar su propio negocio para ser independiente, hasta la fecha no representa dificultades en el negocio ni de salud.
Invertirá en una máquina de coser nueva, equipará su negocio para aumentar la competitividad y mejorar la rentabilidad, espera atraer nuevos clientes, ofrecer mayor calidad de sus servicios y cancelar la deuda adquirida.
Su esfuerzo está enfocado en mejorar su situación económica para dar a su hijo un futuro lleno de oportunidades para un bue  desarrollo académico.
texts.en: Víctor, a tailor, is single and lives with his school-aged son. He receives no help from other sources. He trained to be a tailor 20 years ago; once he had acquired sufficient work experience he decided to set himself up in his own independent business and, to date, he has not had any problems relating to either the business or his health. He wants to invest in buying a new sewing machine so that his business will be better equipped and more competitive as this will enable him to increase his income. He hopes that this will attract new customers, allowing him to improve the quality of his work and to repay his outstanding debts. He concentrates all his efforts on improving his economic situation so that he can provide for his son and offer him a future which will  be full of opportunities for academic development.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, to equip his business in order to be more competitive and to improve his income

loans.name: Cacao Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por dos mujeres y un hombre todos muy emprendedores, que se organizaron hace 2 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus pequeño negocios incrementando su mercadería y así poder mejorar también sus ingresos que les permita poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

Javier Nicasio: Es el coordinador del grupo solidario, originario de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 35 años de edad, es casado, tiene un pequeño hijo de dos años de edad. Con el propósito de apoyar a su esposa para que también genere ingresos en el hogar, solicita su primer financiamiento. Desde hace 4 años luchó para instalarle una pequeña pulpería donde ella vende productos básicos, chiverías, gaseosas. Solicita financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, sopas instantáneas, pan, huevo, entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero y construirle a su familia una vivienda de cemento  para que vivan de manera más segura.
texts.en:
This communal bank group consists of two women and a man who are all entrepreneurs.  They formed the group two months ago in order to have access to a loan to improve their small businesses.  They will increase their inventories and improve their families' incomes to cover basic household needs, guarantee an education for their children and expand their businesses.

Javier Nicasio is the coordinator of the group.  He is 35 and from Puerto Cabezas.  He is married and has a two-year-old son.  In an effort to help his wife earn an income at home he is requesting a loan.  Four years ago he struggled to establish a small grocery store where his wife sells basic products, snacks and sodas.  The loan he is requesting is to buy basic grains, instant soups, bread, eggs and other products.  His dream is for the business to be prosperous so he can build a concrete home for his family to live more safely.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, instant soups, bread, eggs, and other products.

loans.name: Miel Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras (Silvia Mercedes, Ursula y Elba) de la ciudad de Bilwi, Municipio Puerto Cabezas, se unieron hace 2 meses, para acceder a financiamiento mediante crédito para ir incrementando sus pequeños negocios de venta de productos y cosméticos de belleza y pulpería, para mejorar sus ingresos y poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hogares, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas.

Úrsula: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer alegre, está casada, tiene cinco hijos: Tres adolescentes que estudian su secundaria y dos  que cursan su primaria. Su esposo trabaja como distribuidor de gas butano. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos y gastos del hogar, desde hace 10 años comenzó con   su pequeña pulpería donde vende granos básicos, leche, detergentes, jabón y otros productos básicos. Está solicitando su primer financiamiento para comprar más mercadería para su pulpería. Sueña con tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
This communal bank group consists of three women entrepreneurs (Silvia Mercedes, Ursula and Elba).  It is located in the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas.  They formed the group two months ago to have access to loans to expand their small businesses, which are sales of beauty products and groceries.  They want to improve their incomes and cover basic household needs, guarantee an education for their children and improve their homes.

Úrsula is the coordinator of the group.  She is a cheerful woman who is married and has five children: three adolescents in high school and two in grade school.  Her husband works as a butane gas distributor.  In an effort to have her own source of income to support her children's education and household expenses, ten years ago she started a small grocery store where she sells basic grains, milk, detergents, soap and other basic products.  She is requesting her first loan to buy more merchandise for the store.  Her dream is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, milk, detergents, soap and other basic products.

loans.name: Nancy Clemencia

texts.es:
Nancy es una madre responsable, amoroso y protectora que como todas quiere lo mejor para sus dos hijos, y ya que están adolecentes busca que ellos puedan acceder a una educación superior por tal razón solicita de su ayuda para que impulsen su forma de vida la cual es venta de mercancía y accesorios como pañales, perfumes, cremas de mano, toallas, productos de aseo personal en general, gracias a este negocio está a punta de juntar el dinero para pagar un semestre a sus muchachos y con ello el compromiso de semestre a semestre tener el capital para que sus hijos busquen un futuro y sean todos unos profesionales. 
Ayuda ella te necesita.
texts.en:
Nancy is a responsible, loving and protective mother who, like all mothers, wants the best for her two children. As her children are in their teens now, she wants them to have access to higher education. For this reason, Nancy seeks your help to give an boost to her form of earning her living, which is the sale of goods and accessories like diapers, perfumes, hand lotion, towels, and general personal care products. 

Thanks to her business, she has almost raised the money to pay for one term for her children, and with this she will commit to raise the money term by term to enable her children to build their future and to take up a profession.

Help her, she needs you.

loans.use: to buy a supply of diapers, perfumes, ladies' accessories, towels, and personal care products.

loans.name: Ana Gabriela

texts.es:
Ana, de 24 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera de una niña de 4 años y este año comenzará a asistir a la escuela.

Ana, tiene más de 1 años de tener un comedor en la misma comunidad, anteriormente estuvo trabajando en la capital a unos 95 kilómetros de la casa. Debido a la distancia, su madre le cuidaba a su hija, mientras ella trabajaba fuera de la casa, todo esto le afecto pues no atendía la niña y era poco lo que ganaba en ese trabajo.- Ahora, ella está cerca de la casa, cerca de su hija y ha mejorado mucho sus ingresos.- Sus horarios actuales de trabajo son de 7:00 de la mañana a 6:00 de la tarde.
 
Ana, necesita el crédito para comprar materiales como: poliducto, caja térmica y alambre # 10 para instalar energía eléctrica en su casa, ya que tiene cuatro años que construyo su casa y no tiene este servicio aun.- Además, quiere comprar madera para cambiar el techo de su casa, ya que se ha arruinado.

El sueño de Ana es, tener bien arreglada su casa con todos los servicios básicos y darle una buena educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Ana, 24, has a sixth grade education.  She is a single mother with a four-year-old daughter who will begin school this year.

For over a year Ana has been running a diner in her community.  She used to work in the capital city 95 kilometers from her home.  Due to the distance, with her daughter being cared for by her grandmother while her mother was away, and to the fact that she was not earning very much, she now works near home.  She is near her daughter and earning much more income.  Her schedule is from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

Ana is in need of a loan to buy materials such as rubber cables, a thermal box and #10 wire to install electricity in her house.  She built her house four years ago and still does not have electricity.  She also wants to buy rood to change the damaged roof of her house.

Ana's dream is to fix up her house with all the basic utilities and to give her daughter a good education.

loans.use: To buy materials such as rubber cables, a thermal box and #10 wire to install electricity in her house.

loans.name: D3 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo esta conformado por 3 mujeres luchadoras (Claudia, Lucrecia y Esther) que se integraron hace aproximadamente cuatro años, para gestionar  financiamiento mediante créditos con garantía solidaria, para comprar mercadería para sus pequeños negocios de venta de frito, bastimento y pulpería respectivamente, y de esa manera poder vender más y mejorar sus ingresos. Todas ellas quieren lograr mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas.

Claudia: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario D3; es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, casada, tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad. Su esposo vende madera, ella se dedica a la venta de frito (carne con tajadas de plátano y repollo), su puesto de venta está instalado en su casa. El préstamo que está solicitando es para  comprar más ingredientes e insumos para poder ofertar más cantidad de la comida rápida que ella oferta al público.  Ella sueña con llegar a tener una tienda donde venda productos básicos y otras mercaderías para poder mejorar sus ingresos y asi poder también contribuir en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y brindarles un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three women who do not give up in the face of adversity (Claudia, Lucrecia, and Esther). They started their group some four years ago in order to receive funds through loans relying on solidarity lending. They want to buy ingredients and merchandise to sell at their little shops. They sell fried food, side dishes, and groceries respectively. They hope to increase their sales and thus improve their incomes. They all share the same long-term goals: improve their standard of living, afford basic necessities, support their children through school, and improve their houses.
Claudia is the group coordinator. She hails from Puerto Cabezas, is married, and has four adult children. Her husband sells wood while she sells fried food (more specifically, meat with plantain slices and cabbage). Her shop is located at her house. She asks for a loan in order to buy more ingredients with which to cook, so as to be able to sell more fried food to go. Her dream is to own a shop where she could sell basic household items and other merchandise, as this would increase her income and enable her to improve her children's standard of living and give them a better future.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to prepare fried food to go.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy jackets, wholesale.

loans.name: El Diamante Group

texts.es:
El Diamante conformado por cuatro mujeres y con un solo objetivo, el desarrollo de sus negocios y mejoramiento de vida de sus familias, han tomado la decisión de seguir solicitando en ADIM el financiamiento para sus negocios, coordinado por Mercedes una joven de 24 años de edad, casada es propietaria de una panadería además compra y vende pan, esto con el fin de cubrir la demanda que tiene de este producto, cuenta con siete años de experiencias de comercializarlos en la capital, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de barras de pan, polvorón, pan de molde, pico, punto rojo, empanadas, etc., los créditos anteriores le han permitido aumentar la producción de pan y tener nueva clientela. 
El resto de los integrantes son Claudia una señora de 54 años de edad, quien hecha y vende tortilla además vende frijoles cocidos en su domicilio desde hace seis años, Dalila una mujer de 38 años de edad quien comercializa reposterías en el mercado más populoso de la capital desde hace diez años, y María de 35 años de edad, quien se dedica a la venta de pan de forma ambulante en las comunidades cercana a su domicilio desde hace dos años.
texts.en: The communal bank El Diamante (The Diamond) is made up of 4 women with one aim: to develop their businesses and improve their families' lives. They have decided to apply for another loan cycle with ADIM in order to finance their businesses, and this will be coordinated by Mercedes, a 24 year old married woman who owns a bakery in which she also buys and sells bread. Mercedes hopes to be able to satisfy the current demand for this product. She has been selling these products in the capital city for the last 7 years and she is applying for this loan so that she can buy bread loaves, sweet bread cakes, sliced bread, and a variety of speciality pastries such as, pico, punto rojo and empanadas. Her previous loans enabled her to increase her production of bread and to attract new customers. The rest of the group members are: Claudia, a 54 year old woman who has been making and selling tortillas and refried beans from her home for the last 6 years; Dalila, a 38 year old woman who has been selling cakes in the busiest market in the capital city for the last 10 years, and Maria, a 35 year old woman who has been selling bread door-to-door in the communities near to her home for the last 2 years.

loans.use: to buy a range of bread products which will enable her to satisfy the demand for these products.

loans.name: Sector Martinez Group

texts.es:
Al grupo solidario Sector Martínez lo integran cuatro socios laboriosos, quien lo coordina es Jonathan un joven de 25 años de edad, casado y dedicado a la comercialización de ropa y calzado en el mercado de Granada, que solicita por cuarta ocasión el financiamiento de ADIM para su negocio e invertir en la compra de calzado para damas, calzado de niños y niñas, calzado para caballeros, camisetas, talladores, pantalones, etc., con los créditos anteriores ha logrado diversificar los productos ofrecidos, esto lo ha motivado a seguir solicitando los financiamientos para su negocio.
El resto de los integrantes son, la señora Julia quien tiene la edad de 54 años ha dedicado veinticinco años de su vida a la realizar trabajos de bordados y costura en su domicilio, Hayssel una joven de 26 años de edad comerciante de ropa en su comunidad y sectores aledaños desde hace un año, y Mirna una mujer de 50 años de edad su negocio es el destace de cerdo además realiza nacatamales, esto en su domicilio y con una experiencia de dos años en este negocio.
texts.en:
There are four hard working members of the Sector Martínez solidarity group. Jonathan is the coordinator, he is 25 years old, is married and earns a living selling clothes and footwear in the Granada market. He is asking for the fourth time for funding from ADIM for his business and to invest in buying women's footwear, children's footwear, men's footwear, tops, boxer shorts, trousers, etc. With previous loans he has been able to diversify the products he offers which has motivated him to continue to apply for funds for his business.
The rest of the members are Julia who is 54 years old and for 25 years has been doing embroidery and sewing work in her house, Hayssell, who is a young woman who is 26 years old and has been selling clothes in her community and in neighbouring areas for a year, and Mirna, a 50 year old woman who is a pig butcher and also makes nacatamales (a Nicaraguan meat and rice delicacy), which she does at home and in which she has two years of experience.

loans.use: to buy footwear and clothes which will help them improve their income.

loans.name: Rompe Corazones Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROMPE CORAZONES” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida rápida, venta de api, venta de condimentos, taller mecánico, servicio de instalación de gas, venta de poleras, servicio de salón de belleza, venta de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ana es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta condimentos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por impulso de su madre, quien tenía el mismo negocio, posteriormente ella decide emprender un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de condimentos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la frontera Perú - Bolivia y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se puede identificar que una de las clientes no se encuentra en la imagen la misma se marcho con premura a su negocio.
texts.en:
Communal bank 'Rompe Corazones' ('Heartbreakers') is in its fifth lending cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the focus group of Santiago II. It is comprised of eight members, with Ana as president. The members are engaged in various activities, such as: fast-food sales, rice-balls sales, spice sales, auto-repair shop, gas-installation services, clothing sales, beauty salon, and plaid sales.
Loans to the group benefit small women entrepreneurs; it is now Ana's turn. She tells us that she has been with Pro Mujer for three years and that she learned about the institution thanks to a friend, who was already a member of a group. Ana sells spices. She started this business several years ago with the support of her mother, who was engaged in the same trade. After a while, Ana started her own business. 
She will use the loan to increase her working capital by buying spices wholesale from sellers at the Peru-Bolivia border, which she will then sell at her stall. Her business is her sole source of income, necessary to support her family, since she is single. 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she mentions the information about health dispensed by the institution.
In the picture, one of the members of the group is not there because she had to leave early to tend to her business.

loans.use: to buy spices wholesale.

loans.name: Dúo San Miguel Group

texts.es: Dúo San Miguel: este grupo esta conformado por el señor Edgar Emiliano de 46 años de edad, el es propietario de una minilibreria desde hace varios años, el anhelo de el es que su negocio prospere, por esa razon esta solicitando este credito para comprar mercaderia como cuadernos lobros lapices etc. esperando que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
San Miguel Duo

One member of this group is 46-year-old Edgar Emiliano who has owned a small stationery shop for a number of years. Edgar's wish is that his business will prosper. Edgar is applying for this loan in order to buy merchandise such as notebooks, pencils and other items. He hopes that you can help with this loan.

loans.use: to buy stationery items to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Jordan Group

texts.es: Dúo Jordan este grupo esta conformado por la señora Angela de 61 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de consumo diario(productos de consumo diario)desde hace varios años, ella esta muy contenta por trabajar con Fape Kiva es una bendicion contar con un credito para poder invertir en su negocio, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para vender.
texts.en:
Jordan Duo

One member of this group is 61-year-old Angela who has made a living selling consumable goods for a number of years. Angela is very happy to work with Fape and Kiva; it is a blessing to be able to count on support to invest in her business. Angela is applying for a loan in order to buy consumable goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy consumable goods to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Peña De Oro Villa Nueva Group

texts.es: Dúo Peña de Oro Villa Nueva, este crupo esta conformado por la señora Sonia Irene de 57 años de edad, ella posee una tienda de consumo diario(productos comestibles)desde hace varios años, gracias al apoyo de su familia ha podido sali adelante con su negocio, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles ya que nececita invertir mas para generar mejores ganancias y de esa manera seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Peña de Oro Villa Nueva Due

One member of this group is 57-year-old Sonia Irene. She has had a shop selling consumable goods for a number of years. Thanks to her family's support, she has been able to move forward with her business. On this occasion, Sonia is applying for a loan in order to buy consumable goods as she needs to invest to earn higher profits and continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy consumable goods to sell.

loans.name: Haydee Yamires

texts.es:
Haydee, de 43 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, está acompañada, desde hace 23 años se dedica a la agricultura, tienen 3 hijos, uno de ellos está acompañado y solo dos están en casa estudiando.

Haydee, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de productos lácteos,  de esta forma ella ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, se ha dedicado a este negocio, desde hace 23 años y siempre lo ha hecho en la comunidad donde vive.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar leche para elaborar sus productos lácteos. Esto le ayudará a mejorar la venta, porque tendrá más productos para vender y por lo tanto mejorara sus ingresos. 

El principal sueño de Haydee, es ver graduados a sus hijos de una carrera universitaria, ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de continuar estudiando.- Además, desea mejorar su negocio, poniendo un puesto de venta formal en el municipio donde vive.
texts.en:
Haydee is 43 years old and went to school until the third form. She is married and has been a farmer for 23 years. Of the three children the couple has, one is married and two live at home while they finish their studies.
Haydee makes and sells dairy products and thus contributes to household expenses. She has been engaged in this activity for 23 years, all the while in the village where she lives.
She needs the loan to buy milk and transform it into dairy products. If she has more products to sell, her sales and her income will increase. 
Haydee's greatest dream is to see her children graduate university, since she did not have such an opportunity. She is also looking to improve her business by setting up a stall in her village.

loans.use: to buy milk to make dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Santo Tomás, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. Los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café de la variedad catimore desde hace 3 años. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo para dar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café con la compra de plaguicidas y fertilizantes así como para el pago de mano de obra que le apoyan en esta labor. Con esto Santiago espera tener una mejor producción y cosecha para ofrecer a los clientes y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Santiago is 38 years old and lives with his wife and their 4 children in their own rustic home located in the Santo Tomás district, in the province of Cutervo in Cajamarca, in Peru's northern sierra region. The local inhabitants of this area typically work in agriculture, animal husbandry and business.
Santiago works in agriculture, in particular he has been growing a coffee variety known as Catimor for the last 3 years. He is quite experienced in this and he has an excellent reputation in his personal and business affairs. He is applying for this loan so that he can maintain his cultivation of coffee by paying for pesticides and fertilisers as well as labour costs which will allow him to hire extra workers to assist him in his work. Santiago hopes that this will enable him to increase his production level and harvest so that he will have more to sell to his customers and, subsequently, increase his income in order to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee plants by purchasing pesticides and fertilisers as well as paying labour costs

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre que le gusta trabajar en beneficio de su familia, él tiene  7 hijos tres de ellos aún están estudiando, Francisco es casado tiene 48 años de edad y vive en una comunidad de Sololá. 
Francisco es una persona que le pone mucho empeño a  su trabajo,  con el trabajo que él ejerce ha sacado avante a su familia, Francisco se dedica a la albañilería, el construye casas, muros todo lo relacionado a construcción, él es una persona con mucha experiencia en este trabajo ya que lleva ya varios años en ejercerlo.

Francisco ama mucho a su familia, ya que lo prioritario para él siempre ha sido ellos, con el trabajo de albañilería ha podido sostener  los gastos de la casa y el estudio de sus hijos, pues ahora ya cuenta con una  parte de sus hijos que son profesionales, pues ahora con el apoyo de sus hijos se han puesto de acuerdo en remodelar su casa ya que la casa que tiene no es tan acorde para su familia, por tal motivo Francisco anda en busca de un préstamo para la remodelación de su casa, que tanto ha anhelado
texts.en:
Francisco is a man who finds joy in working to support his family. He has seven children, three of whom still go to school. He is 48 years old, married, and lives in a village in Sololá.
He works as hard as he can because he knows that that is how he supports his family. He is a mason and builds houses, walls, and does general construction work. He has been in this line of work for several years and is thus very experienced.

Francisco loves his family very much and they are his top priority. Thanks to his work, he has been able to cover household expenses and support his children through school. Indeed, several of his children now have a career. Now, with the help of his children, he will make several changes to the house, since it is not very suitable for the family. Thus, Francisco is looking for a loan in order to make these changes and fulfil his dream of improving his house.

loans.use: to improve his house.

loans.name: Abril Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Abril está conformado por cuatro mujeres (María Yajaira, Delmy, Noemi Noruel y Birdet Lizzete), todas son indígenas  miskitas de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que  venden mariscos y nacatamal, con cuyos ingresos aportan para las necesidades básicas de sus hogares. Se organizaron hace dos meses para acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana.

María Yajaira: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una joven luchadora de 25 años de edad, madre  soltera de dos hijos: El mayor de 6 años de edad estudia su primer grado de primaria y un pequeño de 3 años de edad. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de pescado y mariscos que compra en la comunidad miskita cercana a Bilwi que se llama Lamlaya (agua mansa), de esta manera genera ingresos propios que le ayudan a solventar  la alimentación de sus hijos y luchar para darle los estudios a su hijo. Está solicitando su primer financiamiento para poder comprar más  mariscos y pescados para vender e incrementar sus ingresos . Ella sueña con llegar a contar con suficiente capital para establecer una tienda donde venda ropa, especialmente ropa usada que es lo que más demanda la población actualmente.
texts.en:
The group is comprised of four women (María Yajaira, Delmy, Noemi Noruel, and Birdet Lizzete). All of them are of the Miskito ethnic group and live in the town of Bilwi, in the district of Puerto Cabezas. These women entrepreneurs sells shrimp and natacamales (a Nicaraguan dish similar to the tamale). Thanks to the income they derive from these activities, they contribute to household expenses. Two months ago, they formed a group in order to benefit from the loans offered by Pana Pana, which rely on the principle of solidarity lending.
María Yajaira is the group coordinator. This young woman of 25 years of age, a single mother of two, never gives up in the face of adversity. Her older son is six years old and attends first year of primary school. The younger son is three years old. María Yajaira has been selling fish and shrimp for eight years. She buys these products in a Miskito village near Bilwi. The village is called Lamlaya, which means 'calm waters' in Miskito. Thus, María Yajaira generates an income of her own, thanks to which she can feed her children and do her utmost to ensure her older son goes to school. She asks for her first loan in order to buy more shrimp and more fish so as to sell more and increase her income. Her dream is to save enough money to set up a shop and sell clothes, especially used clothing, which is very much in demand.

loans.use: to buy shrimp and fish to sell.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
Virgilio es una persona que se dedica a su trabajo para el bienestar de su familia, él vive en una comunidad de Sololá tiene una hermosa familia de 7 hijos todos están bajo la responsabilidad de él. 
Virgilio es un padre que lucha cada día para que familia tengan lo necesario,  él se dedica a la agricultura,  este oficio lo aprendió de su padre desde pequeño, ya que por la pobreza en que vivían sus padres Virgilio no tuvo la oportunidad de ira a escuela, él ahora no sabe leer ni escribir, pero con el oficio que le enseño su padre genera los ingresos para su familia. 
Pues a él le gusta sembrar diversidad de hortalizas, anteriormente sembraba en  poca cantidad, pero ahora con  el apoyo de sus hijos siembra, mas, sus hijas para ayudar a su papá en la generación de ingresos se dedican al tejido artesanal. Virgilio vive muy feliz ya que ahora tiene el apoyo de sus hijos, Virgilio desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido comprar un lote de terreno para construir una casa para sus hijos, pero lamentablemente por la escases económica no lo ha podido hacer, pues ahora con el apoyo de sus hijos genera un poco mas de ingresos, razón por la cual ellos están buscando un préstamo para realizar esta compra, el sueño de Virgilio es comprar el terreno para la construcción de su vivienda para que sus hijos tengan un lugar donde descansar.
texts.en:
Virgilio works in order to look after his family's well-being. He lives in a community of Sololá and has a beautiful family of seven children, all of whom depend on him.

Virgilio is a father who works hard every day so that his family will have what they need. He works in farming, having learned the trade from his father from a young age. Owing to how poor the family was, Virgilio was not able to go to school and he cannot read or write. With the trade his father taught him, however, Virgilio is able to earn an income for his family.

Virgilio likes to grow a selection of vegetables. Previously he grew in small quantities but now, with the support of his children, he sows more. Virgilio's daughters also work knitting handicrafts in order to earn an income and support their father. Virgilio is very happy as he has the support of his children. For a long time Virgilio has wanted to buy his own land to build a house for his children. Unfortunately, with little money, he has not been able to do it. Now, however, his children are earning a little money and so Virgilio has come to apply for a loan in order to buy the land. 

Virgilio's dream is to buy land to build a house so that his children may have a place to rest.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe tiene 53 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo en el distrito de Ferreñafe, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población de esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de café y con fincas fruteras en buen estado. Felipe además se dedica al cultivo de maíz, yuca, entre otros, y se desempeña como peón agrícola en la zona realizando trabajos de cultivo de café. Cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del crédito será para invertir en el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café con la compra de abono y fertilizantes, con esto Felipe espera mejorar la productividad de su cultivo y ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes, lo que le generará mayores ingresos y le permitirá incrementar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Felipe is 53 years old and in a civil partnership. He lives with his wife and his child in the district of Ferreñafe in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region of the north coast of Peru. The people of this area earn a living in he main economic activities of farming, business and in livestock breeding. 

Felipe earns a living in farming, he has coffee plants and fruit farms in good condition. Felipe also grows corn, yucca, and other things and he is also a farm labourer in the area doing work related to coffee growing. He has experience in the area and has very good personal and work references. This loan will be used to invest in maintaining his coffee growing by buying manure and fertilizers. With this, Felipe hopes to improve the productivity of his plants and offer better products to his customers which will help him to generate a better income and will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to invest in maintaining his coffee plants by buying manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Para Luz Marina su tienda lo es todo, un proyecto que inicio desde el año 2008, por necesidad ante la falta de oportunidades para encontrar trabajo y en estos tiempos es mucho más difícil puesto que a sus 53 años de edad ninguna empresa le daría empleo.
Ella es madre de una hija ya mayor de edad, sus propósitos son mejorar las condiciones de vida de su casa, juntar capital, ahorrar, para estar preparada para el futuro y seguir trabajando hasta que su salud se lo permita.
Luz Marina solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido en granos, abarrotes lácteos, víveres para abastecer su negocio
texts.en:
For Luz Marina, her store is everything. It is a project which she started in 2008, out of necessity because of the lack of opportunities to find work. It was very difficult for her at that time, because at 53 years there was not company which wanted to employ her.

Luz Marina is mother of a grown-up daughter. It is her plan to improve the living conditions in her home, to raise capital, to save in order to be prepared for the future, and to continue working as long as her health permits.

Luz Marina is asking for a loan in order to stock her store with grains, groceries, dairy products, and other basic products.

loans.use: to buy grains, groceries, and dairy products.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Sandra es una dedicada mujer de 30 años de edad, madre de 3 hijos todos ellos menores de edad, que inicio su negocio de venta de comidas gracias a su esposo quien la guio y le enseño de la profesión.
Su motor de vida son sus hijos y por ellos sacara su negocio adelante es difícil ya que ella es sola, pero seguirá trabajando para brindarle a su familia una excelente calidad de vida.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de pollos, refrescos y frutas para impulsar y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra is a dedicated 30-year-old woman and is mother of three children, all minors. She started her business selling food thanks to her husband, who guided her and taught her this profession. Her two children are the engine of her life and for them, she is getting her business ahead. This is difficult, because she is on her own, but she continues working hard in order to provide her family with an excellent quality of life.

She is asking for a loan to buy chicken, soft drinks, and fruits, in order to promote and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy chicken, soft drinks, and fruits.

loans.name: Lisbei Lised

texts.es: Lisbey es una de tantas mujeres jóvenes que por falta de oportunidades no han podido posicionarse en un trabajo, y es que la historia de esta mujer de 25 años de edad está marcada por la desigualdad y los bajos recursos, pero sin quejarse y con trabajo ejerciéndose como independiente ha sabido ganarse la vida, vende productos de la marca amway, básicamente productos de uso y consumo personal y ahora pide una ayuda para comprar surtido en cantidades para tener una mejor utilidad y hacer de esta pequeña chispa de esperanza una llamara de oportunidades y de progreso para ella y su familia
texts.en:
Lisbei is one of many young women who have not been able to find a job. She is 25 years old, and the problem is that during these years, she has faced inequality and poverty. However, she has not complained and has made headway by working independently. She sells Amway products, especially personal products.

Lisbei is requesting help to buy products in bulk in order to improve the profitability of her business, and transform this spark of hope into a flame of opportunities to get ahead, both for her and for her family.

loans.use: to buy personal products to sell.

loans.name: Jacinta Asuncion

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Las Colinas Del Progreso esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.
 La señora Jacinta tiene 35 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión  y de esta relación tiene seis hijos de 17, 16, 14, 9, 7 y 5 años de edad, tres  estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Jacinta es una muy buena esposa que le gusta trabajar para así ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar ya que el no gana mucho en sus actividades, ella tiene una pequeña granja en la cual se dedica a la cría de pollos, compra estos animalitos cuando aun están pequeños los mismos que cría por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado y luego los vende por libras a vecinos de su localidad, con esto ella se gana lo suyo que les sirve para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para que estos tengan un buen desarrollo. Lleva 7 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y  le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otros lugares de crédito. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank “Las Colinas del Progreso” meet fortnightly in El Progreso, a neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo. This is a poor and highly-populated area of the city.

Jacinta is 35 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage and has six children, ages 17, 16, 14, 9, 7, and 5. Three of them go to secondary school and the youngest to primary school. Her husband is a mason. Jacinta is a good wife and likes to work in order to help her husband with the home expenses, considering that he does not receive a good salary. She has a small farm where she raises chickens. She buys them when they are small and raises them for around three or four months until they reach a good weight to be sold by the pound to neighbors. She contributes with what she earns.

Jacinta will use this loan to buy chickens, and feed and medicines for them, so that they grow healthy. This is her seventh cycle with this group and she likes to be a member because the interest rate is lower than in other credit agencies. Her dream is to be able to give her children the best things.

loans.use: to buy chickens, and feed and medicines for them.

loans.name: Diana Paola

texts.es:
Diana es una sorprendente joven de 19 años de edad, llena de aspiraciones y un futuro por delante, desde pequeña mostro gran interés por el trabajo independiente y ahora tiene una licorera y gracias a ella puede generar recursos para ayudar en su hogar y pagar sus estudios.
Ella es joven comete errores pero lo importante es mostrarle apoyo para que siga pro este buen camino, solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido variado de licores el monto es justificado por el precio alto de algunos licores y necesita en cantidades su sueño es progresar y un día tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Diana, 19, is an amazing young woman. She has many aspirations and a bright future. Since she was a girl, she has been interested in being an independent worker. She now owns a liquor store, with which she contributes to the home expenses and pays for her studies.

She is young and makes mistakes, but what is important is to support her so that she can continue going in the right direction. She is requesting a loan to buy assorted alcoholic beverages. The reason why she is requesting this much money is that some beverages are expensive and she needs to buy them in bulk. Her dream is to make headway and be able to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of alcoholic beverages to fullfill her customers' demands.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is thirty-two years old. He is married with three children aged between eight and seventeen. Two of his three children go to school. He has a shop and has been selling items in his business for five years. With the loan, he would like to buy more rice, sugar and soap to resell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and soap

loans.name: Hernando De Jesus

texts.es: El motivo que lleva a Hernando a estar solicitando un crédito lo tiene es sus manos es la compra de una guadañadora para realizar sus servicios de corte de césped, una actividad que le ha permitido mantener a su familia que la conforman su pareja y 4 hijos, Hernando de verdad necesita mucho de esta herramienta de trabajo que es la principal, ayúdalo a seguir ejerciendo la actividad con la que alimenta a su familia.
texts.en:
The reason why Hernando is requesting a loan is what he is holding in his hands: he wants to buy a brush cutter. He mows lawns, an activity that has helped him to support his family, comprised of his wife and four children.

Hernando really needs this tool, which is central to his work. Help him to be able to continue performing this activity, which is how he brings food to the table.

loans.use: to buy the brush cutter he is holding in the picture.

loans.name: Yafaye

texts.fr:
Madame Yafaye est une dame très dynamique aussi bien dans le banc villageois que dans ses activités. Elle est mariée, âgée de 46 ans et mère 04 enfants dont 02 garçons et 02 filles. Elle est vendeuse de poisson séché et d’huile de palme dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa zone produits qu’elle achète via les transporteurs. Elle a une grande expérience dans ce domaine.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 100 litre pour l’huile de palme et 80 000 Fra de poissons séchés par panier.
 
Avec les bénéfices, elle apporte un appui à son mari dans la gestion des charges des enfants (scolarité, habillement, ...) la famille.
texts.en:
Yafaye is a dynamic woman who works well in both her business and the 'Banc Villageois'.  She is 46 years old, married and mother to four children, two girls and two boys.  She sells dried fish and palm oil at the local, weekly markets.  She buys her supplies from transporters and has a lot of experience.

Yafaye will use her loan to buy 100 litres of palm oil and dried fish for 80,000 francs CFA a basket.  Her profits will help her husband to provide for the expenses of their children (schooling, clothing, etc.).

loans.use: to buy 100 litres of palm oil and dried fish for 80,000 francs CFA a basket.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
Juan Alberto tiene 33 años, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus 02 menores hijos en el distrito de Pucará, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, en la región de Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú. Las actividades principales que se desarrollan en el distrito son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

La actividad a la que se dedica Juan Alberto es la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 4 años, cuenta con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la cosecha. De esta manera Juan Alberto espera mejorar la calidad del café que ofrecerá a sus clientes lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Alberto is 33 years old. He lives in his own house made of rustic materials with his wife and their 2 minor children in the district of Pucará. It is located in the province of Jaén,  in the Cajamarca region, northern sierra of Peru. The main activities of the district are agriculture, livestock and commerce.

Juan Alberto's activity is agriculture, specifically growing coffee. He has 4 years' experience in this area. He has regular customers who offer very good personal and work references. The loan will be to buy compost and fertilizer to do crop maintenance as well as to hire labor for the harvest. In this way, Juan Alberto hopes to improve the quality of the coffee that he will offer to his customers. This will increase his level of income and allow him and his family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer for crop maintenance as well as to hire labor for the harvest.

loans.name: Miriam Magdalena

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Las Colinas Del Progreso esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.
 La señora Miriam tiene 43 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión  libre y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad, el cual estudia en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Miriam es una gran ama de casa y buena esposa que le gusta trabajar para así ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella vende productos de Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los  días y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella también le da parte del crédito a su marido el cual se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, el vende ciertos días de la semana en el mercado local, ella lleva 2 años en esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por su cuenta y su marido muchos años mas .
Este crédito es para comprar frutas, legumbres y productos Avon. Lleva 8 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son que su hijo nunca le falte nada.
texts.en:
The credit group "Las Colinas del Progreso" meets every fortnight in "El Progreso" citadel in the city of Portoviejo. It is a highly populated, urban and marginal area of the city.

Miriam is 43 years old and she is in a relationship of consensual union. Her partner is a merchant and they have a 10-year-old son who goes to school. Doña Miriam is a great stay-at-home mother and partner.

To help with the house expenses, she works selling Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and lady accessories). She works everyday selling door-to-door. This occupation, which she has had for 2 years, allows her to make some money on her own.

She shares the loan with her partner. He makes a living selling fruits and legumes at the local market and has been doing so for many years.

This loan is to buy fruits, legumes and Avon products. Miriam has been a member of the credit group "Las Colinas del Progreso" for 8 years and she likes it because the loans are very helpful. Her dream is that her son won't ever want for anything.

loans.use: to buy fruits, legumes and Avon products

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is married and has been blessed with three school-going children. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the upbringing of their children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor running water. 

Zuhura has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge high cost of transportation in her place of operation. Zuhura dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruit for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruit for resale.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with three children, all of whom still attend school and are still under her care. They live at a rented house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children.

Chizi operates a clothes selling business, where she sells at the market to town dwellers and her neighbours. In addition, she sells food to supplement her income. She cites her largest business challenge as seasonality. Chizi dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en:
Teddy's group is comprised of three hard working women. Teddy is twenty-three years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Teddy has been working hard to manage her bakery store, which bakes bread and doughnuts. 

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase items for baking, such as baking flour and cooking oil. This will help Teddy to generate greater profits, which she will use to repair her motorcycle which is in a bad mechanical condition so that it can help her in transporting her bread and doughnuts.

Teddy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase baking flour, cooking oil and other ingredients for baking bread

loans.name: Oumy's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 10 Décembre 2012, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très désireuses de faire prospérer leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Il existe une bonne connexion entre les membres du groupe, elles viennent d’entamer leur quatrième cycle dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles habitent toutes le même quartier et s’activent principalement dans le petit commerce et la transformation de produits locaux.

Madame Oumy  (assise à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe, c’est une dame très dynamique, qui connait une nette amélioration de son activité depuis son adhésion au programme. Elle mène diverses activités : la vente de tissus et chaussures, de jus à base de produits locaux au marché central. Elle jouit d’une grande expérience dans le petit commerce.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte s’approvisionner en plus des tissus pour une valeur de 300 000, un sac de sucre, 5 sacs de bissap rouge, du pain de singe et divers ingrédients pour la préparation des jus.

Ses bénéfices, en plus de soutenir ses parents lui permettront d’avoir une indépendance financière pour la satisfaction de ses besoins.
texts.en:
The 'Banc Villageois' was created on 10th December 2012.  It is made up of women who want to make their businesses prosper.  The members of the group are closely linked and this will be their fourth loan from the field partner.  The women all live in the same neighbourhood and work preparing and selling local products.

Oumy (sitting on the right in the photo, with her hand raised) is the group representative.  She is very active and has seen a marked improvement in her business since she started working with the field partner.  She has several business activities - selling fabric, shoes and locally-produced juice at the central market.  She has a lot of experience in her business.  Oumy plans to use her loan to buy 300,000 francs CFA of fabric, a sack of sugar, five sacks of red hibiscus flowers, baobab fruit and other ingredients used to prepare juices.

Her profits will enable her to help her parents and become more independent and able to provide for her needs.

loans.use: to buy fabric to a value of 300,000francs CFA, a sack of sugar, 5 sacks of red hibiscus flowers, baobab fruit and other ingredients needed to prepare juice.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Ann is fifty-seven years old and married to Julius. They are blessed with ten children who are all adults. Ann has been selling snacks for the last thirty years and earns a monthly income of 7,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

She has applied for his fifth loan of 10,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy more seedlings and fertilizers for use in her farm.

She will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy stocks of wheat flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Fall Yaye Boye Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
C e groupe est composé de femmes très déterminées dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Ces dernières ayant un long vécu dans le programme des bancs villageois ont su développer un esprit de solidarité leur permettant de nos jours de faire face à beaucoup de situations. Ce groupement est l’un des meilleurs de la région. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fall Yaye (assise à l’extrême droite  avec la main  gauche levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe, âgée de 54 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 04 garçons et 03  filles. C’est l’une des personnes les plus déterminées du groupe, elle est courageuse et sérieuse dans la gestion de ses activités. Elle est  vendeuse de fruits : bananes, oranges et autres divers légumes au marché de son quartier. Elle s’approvisionne dans la zone maraichère via les transporteurs. 

Avec ce prêt elle va acheter : 2 paniers choux, 01 carton de carotte, 10 kg de poivre non moulu et divers autres condiments.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner  et  de participer activement dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille
texts.en:
This group is made up of very determined business women with a long history of working with the 'Banc Villageois'.  They are very supportive of one another and have had to face many difficult situations.  This is one of the best groups in the region, and they all work as retailers.

Fall Yaye (sitting on the far right in the photo) is the group representative.  She is 54 years old, married and mother to seven children, four boys and three girls.  She is one of the most determined women in the group, courageous and hard-working.  Fall Yaye sells fruit (bananas, oranges etc) at her local market.  She buys her supplies from local producers, via transporters.

Fall Yaye plans to use her loan to buy two baskets of cabbages, one box of carrots, ten kilos of unground pepper and various other food items.  Her profits will saved and used to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy 2 baskets of cabbage, 1 box of carrots, 10kgs of unground pepper and other food items.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is married and has children. She owns a house that has electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her kids.

For the past two years, she has operated a chemist business, where she sells to town dwellers and her neighbours. She dreams of expanding her business so that she can meet her family's basic needs. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase various types of medicine and cosmetic products for sale.She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase various types of medicine and cosmetic products

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married mother and all of her children attend school. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor running water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Lucy dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, rice, beans, maize flour and sugar for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat, rice, beans, maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Chuimanzana Group

texts.es:
María es una mujer  muy dedicada a  su trabajo, ella es casada tiene 27 años, vive junto a su hermosa familia de 2 hijos  uno de 9 años y el otro de 5 años. 
María (Señora que aparece en el lado izquierdo dela foto) desde pequeña su mamá le enseño, que todo trabajo se debe de hacer  con esmero y dedicación, pues María con los consejos de su mama, ella ahora se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica ella hace  güipiles, sutes fajas, perrajes  y todo lo relacionado al traje típico, ella lleva 15 años con este trabajo,  ella es muy reconocida  en el mercado donde vende y es muy responsable de los pedidos.
María lo que busca es superación en la vida personal y para su familia, pues el anhelo de ella es seguir elaborando más productos para generar más ingresos y ganancias, con eso puede apoyar a su esposo con todo lo necesario para el progreso de su familia, María es muy trabajadora, pero la dificultad de ella, es que no cuenta con capital de trabajo para  la inversión del negocio, ella está buscando ahora un préstamo y el uso que le va dar es comprar más materia prima.
texts.en:
María is a woman who is very dedicated to her job. She is married and is 27 years old. She lives with her beautiful family made up of 2 children, aged 9 and 5 years old. 
 
María (the woman on the left in the photo) was taught from when she was little by her mother that every job should be done with hard work and dedication. With her mother's advice, María now works making traditional clothing. She makes güipiles, tzutes girdles, perrajes, and everything related the traditional clothing. She has been doing this work for 15 years. She is very well known in the market where she sells and she is very responsible with her orders. 

María wants to get ahead personally and with her family. What she wants is to keep making more products to generate more income and profits. With this, she can help her husband with everything necessary for the family's progress. María is very hardworking but her problem is that she doesn't have working capital to invest in the business. Now she is seeking a loan to use to buy more raw materials.

loans.use: to buy materials (thread).

loans.name: Medza

texts.en:
Medza is a married woman. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Medza dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres Toronjal Group

texts.es:
Candelaria (señora que aparece en medio) es una mujer que trabaja con esmero y dedicación cada día para sacar adelante a su familia ella, tiene  58 años de edad, vive en una comunidad llamada chócola. 

Candelaria desde hace ya varios años se dedica a la venta de ropa típica, ella vende en su comunidad y lugares aledaños, es una mujer muy agradable y por lo mismo es reconocida por su comunidad. 

Candelaria se dedica a la venta de ropa típica de su comunidad, ella  monto su negocio con un pequeño ahorro que tenia, pero no podía comprar todo lo que necesitaba el negocio, entonces ella decidió buscar un préstamo en Adicla y gracias a Dios lo obtuvo, con ese dinero pudo completar su negocio, y alcanzar  como era el plan de Candelaria.
 
El negocio cambio su vida ya que ahora genera más ingresos para su familia, Candelaria le ha puesto empeño y dedicación por lo mismo el negocio está incrementando, ahora necesita más capital de trabajo para seguir incrementado y comprar más variedades de ropa.

 La meta de Candelaria es conseguir el préstamo para que el negocio sea un éxito y con las ganancias que genera. El sueño y anhelo de Candelaria es tener su propio local de venta para exhibir mejor sus productos.
texts.en:
Candelaria (the woman in the middle) is a woman who works hard with dedication every day to get her family ahead. She is 58 years old and lives in a community called Chócola. 

For several years, Candelaria has worked selling traditional clothing. She sells in her community and in nearby areas. She is a friendly woman and because of that, she is well known in her community. 

Candelaria works selling traditional clothing. She opened her little business with some small savings that she had, but she couldn't buy everything she needed for the business, so she decided to seek a loan from Adicla, and thank God she got it and was able to attain her plan.
 
The business changed her life because now it generates more income for her family. Candelaria has put work and dedication and because of that her business is growing. Now she needs more capital to keep growing and to buy more types of clothing.

Candelaria's goal is to get the loan so the business will be a success. With the profits she generates, Candelaria's dream and wish is to have a sales locale to better exhibit her products.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing.

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es una sonriente joven de 24 años de edad, que agradece mucho encontrarse con excelente personas en su vida, que la ayudaron amontar su propio negocio de venta de productos de la canasta familiar, actividad que aprendió trabajando en otras tiendas donde la motivaron a iniciar su negocio y hoy viene a solicitar un crédito para comprar surtido para abastecer lo que dice con mucho orgullo su propio negocio.
Con el crédito comprara granos, abarrotes, frituras, dulces, refrescos y productos de limpieza, se parte del grupo de transformadores de vida de esta joven ayúdala!
texts.en:
Yolanda is a smiling 24-year-old young woman who is very grateful to have found excellent people in her life, who helped her open her own business selling staple items, work she learned in other stores which motivated her to start her own business. Today she comes to ask for a loan to purchase an assortment to stock, what she says with great pride, her own business.

With the loan she will purchase grains, groceries, fried snacks, sweets, soft drinks, and cleaning products. Be part of the transforming group in this young woman's life -- help her!

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of general cleaning products, sweets, soft drinks, fried snacks and chocolates.

loans.name: Bilma Isabel

texts.es:
Bilma es madre cabeza de familia de 50 años de edad, su hijo de 14 ha encontrado en ella un padre y una madre lo que la hace tan especial, esta imponente y sorprendente mujer genera sus ingresos gracias a su negocio que ubico en su hogar de confección de línea propia, ella misma crea sus diseños, es vendedora, cortara, confeccionista un verdadero pulpo.
Bilma hace tiempo ha querido comprar una maquina recubridora la cual facilitara y agilizara sus tiempos de producción, permitiéndole sacar mayor producción pero su principal inconveniente es la falta de capital por ello solicita un crédito para la compra de esta máquina.
texts.en:
Bilma, 50, is a female head of household. Her 14-year-old son has found in her a father and mother, which makes her very special. This impressive and surprising woman generates her income thanks to her business, located in her home, sewing her own line. She creates the designs herself, is saleswoman, cutter, seamstress, a real octopus. 

Bilma, for some time, has wanted to purchase an overlock machine which will ease and speed up her production times, allowing her to have more production, but her primary inconvenience is the lack of capital, so for this she is asking for a loan to purchase this machine.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock machine to improve her production time.

loans.name: Carmen Del Rocio

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Las Colinas Del Progreso esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.
 La señora Carmen tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera de un  hijo de 4 años de edad el cual estudian en jardín de infantes. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. 
Doña Carmen es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar duro para sacar adelante a su hijo por el cual hace lo que sea ya que es padre y madre a la vez, ella en sociedad con su papá tienen una panadería, allí ellos elaboran pan de varios sabores así como también tortas, roscas y muchos productos mas que son el deleite de su clientes que a diario compran en su local, desde la madrugada ellos se levantan para tener listo todo para cuando lleguen sus clientes, ella lleva 10 años trabajando en esta actividad y su papá mucho más tiempo ya que así como el siempre se gano la vida y así ella aprendió esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar harina, huevos, azúcar y muchos otros ingredientes para preparar el pan. Lleva 2 años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su pequeño.
texts.en:
In the El Progreso fortress of Portoviejo, the communal bank group Las Colinas del Progreso meets every two weeks. This is a marginal urban zone, highly populous, of this city.

Carmen is 35 years old, she is a single mother with a 4-year-old son who goes to kindergarten. She lives in her parents' house. 

Carmen is a woman who has had to work hard to get her son ahead, so she does whatever needs to be done since she is both father and mother. She, with her father, has a bakery. There, they make bread of various flavors and also cakes, roscas [king cake], and many more products that are the delight of their customers who buy in their shop every day. They get up very early in the morning to have everything ready for when their customers arrive. She has worked in this for 10 years, and her father much more time, since it is in this way that he has always earned his living. In this way she learned this work which permits her to earn a living. 

The loan will be used to purchase flour, eggs, sugar and many other ingredients to make the bread. She has been in the loan group for 2 years and she likes it for the help that it provides her with the loans. Her dreams are to give the best to her little one.

loans.use: to purchase flour, eggs, sugar and other ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Mónica Dolores Betsabe

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Las Colinas Del Progreso esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.
La señora Dolores tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y uno de 10 años, los mayores estudian en universidad y el menor en  escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Dolores es una mujer muy trabajadora  que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto solventar los gastos del hogar hace 8 años atrás empezó un negocio de venta de encebollados en un local en su casa, allí trabaja de lunes a sábados preparando este delicioso plato que es el deleite de sus clientes, allí trabaja con la ayuda de familia ya que es un negocio en el cual se ganan la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado,  yuca, sodas y artículos para arreglar más su local. Lleva cinco ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella mejora su negocio.  Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
In the El Progreso fortress of Portoviejo, the communal bank group Las Colinas del Progreso meets every two weeks. This is a marginal urban zone, highly populous, of this city.

Dolores is 52 years old, married, and from this relationship has three children, two adults and one who is 10 years old, the older ones study at the university and the younger one at school. Her husband is a businessman. 

Dolores is a very hard-working woman who, in order to get her own resources and with this pay some of the household expenses, 8 years ago began a business selling encebollados [onion dishes] in a space in her house. There, she works from Monday to Saturday preparing this delicious dish which is the delight of her customers, she works there with the help of her family since it is a business from which they earn their living.

This loan is to purchase fish, yucca, sodas, and things to fix up her store. She has been in the communal bank group for five loan cycles and she likes it because, with the loans, she improves her business. Her dreams are to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase fish, yucca, sodas and things to fix up her space.

loans.name: Sabana's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée depuis le 26 Septembre 2014,est constitué de cinq membres qui habitent tous dans le même village.Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Adama,âgée de 44 ans,se trouvant debout a droite de la photo et levant le bras, est notre emprunteuse vedette.
Elle est mariée et mère de neuf enfants dont cinq garçons et quatre fille.Elle pratique le petit commerce comme activité principale.

Avec son prêt,elle compte acheter du thé d'une valeur de 10000f, du sucre d'une valeur de 20000f,des légumes a hauteur de 15000f et le reste pour les frais de transport.

Avec son bénéfice,elle souhaite participer aux charges familiales et renforcer son fond de roulement.
texts.en:
This group, which was set up on 26th September 2014, is made up of five members who all live in the same village. Their main activity is trading.

Adama, who is 44 years old and standing on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is our star borrower. She is married and mother to nine children: five boys and four girls. Her main activity is running a small trading business. With her loan she is planning to buy tea to a value of 10,000 francs, sugar to a value of 20,000 francs and 15,000 francs worth of vegetables; the remainder will be used for transport costs.

With the profit she makes, she would like to be able to contribute to the family's expenses and boost her working capital.

loans.use: to buy goods.

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée depuis Septembre 2014,est constitué de 24 membres habitant tous dans la même localité.Elle pratiquent le commerce comme activité principale.

Mariama, âgée de 42 ans,se trouvant debout a droite de la photo et levant le bras,est notre emprunteuse vedette. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont quatre garçons et une fille.Elle effectue le commerce comme activité principale.

Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 05 sacs de 50 kg d'arachide a 4500f le sac, 25 kg de fonio a 15000f et le reste elle va acheté de la farine et de l'huile.

Avec son bénéfice, elle compte épargner et subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
This group, which was set up in September 2014, is made up of 24 members who all live in the same town. Their main activity is trading.

Mariama, who is 42 years old and standing on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is our star borrower. She is married and mother to five children: four boys and one girl. Her main activity is running a small trading business. 

With her loan she is planning to buy five 50 kilos sacks of groundnut at 4,500 francs the sack and 25 kilos of fonio at a cost of 15,000 francs; the remainder will be used to buy flour and oil.

With the profit she makes, she is planning to save some money and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Damaris Inocencia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Las Colinas Del Progreso esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.
 La señora Damaris tiene 42 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión  y de esta relación tiene siete hijos, 6 mayores  de edad y el menor de 14 años el cual  estudia en colegio, 4 de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es albañil.
