Teresa con el afán de ayudar a su esposo, para la generación de ingresos económicos, pues desde hace cuatro años, se dedica a la elaboración de productos elaborada con mostacilla, pues por la misma necesidad que tiene su familia, la obligo a realizar este oficio ella lo aprendió con su suegra, pues es así como Teresa ayuda a su familia  para salir adelante.
Teresa como toda mamá, es responsable de velar por las necesidades de un hogar. Ella se dio cuenta, que  para la higiene de sus hijos es necesario la construcción de un servicio sanitario, ya que este favorece a que sus hijos tengan un lugar más  apropiado donde hacer sus necesidades fisiológicas, para evitarse de enfermedades haciéndole al aire libre,   a raíz de esta necesidad Teresa, busca un préstamo para llevar a cabo este trabajo ya que es muy necesario y útil para su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa (the member who appears on the right side of the photo) is a very optimistic woman, who likes to support her family. She got married at a very young age, and now is 26 years old and has two children, one who is 7 and the other who is a year and 5 months old. She lives together with her family in the community of Sololá. 

Teresa wanted to help her husband by generating an income, so for the last 4 years she has worked making clay products. She learned this skill to help her family, and learned it with her mother-in-law. In this way Teresa helps her family to get ahead. 

Like many mothers, Teresa is responsible for looking after the necessities of her home. She realised that for the hygiene of her children, she needs to build a proper bathroom so that her kids can have a more appropriate place for their physiological necessities, and to avoid illness. Because of this necessity, Teresa is asking for a loan to build this bathroom, since it is very necessary and useful for her family.

loans.use: to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years now.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell.

loans.name: Genaro Antonio

texts.es:
El objetivo de género es iniciar su negocio de coladero, una actividad que sería la primera en el barrio y que años atrás aprendió gracias a un amigo, desea iniciar el negocio pro dos nobles razones, una por que la necesidad económica y dos pro que es la profesión que lo supo hacer feliz mientras la ejercía. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido, activos y herramientas para la fabricación de este, que sabe que le traerá grandes beneficios al barrio y aspira en 5 años poder contar con empleados y difundir esta actividad entre los habitantes de la zona.
texts.en:
Genaro's goal is to start his colada [black corn flour and fruit drink] business. It will be the first in the neighbourhood. He learned the work years ago from a friend and wants to start the business for two noble reasons: one, because of economic need, and two, because the work makes him very happy.
He is requesting a loan to purchase stock: tools and supplies for making coladas. He knows that this business will bring him a large income in the neighbourhood and hopes in 5 years to be able to have employees and sell to the entire zone.

loans.use: to start a unique colada business

loans.name: Leida

texts.en:
Leida works hard to support her family. Leida is married and has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of banana to sell.

Leida has been in this business for thirty years now.

In the future, Leida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase of additional sacks of banana to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is forty-eight years old and married with five children, two of whom attend school. Edna works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, egg, chips and bread.

Edna has been in this business for twenty years. 

In the future Edna would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, egg, chips and bread

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 38 years old, married and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Tessie requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her farming equipment.

Tessie has been farming rice for seven years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Tessie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her faming equipment

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is 34 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, bread, soft drinks, chips, etc.

Edelyn has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, bread, soft drinks, chips, etc

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 29 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Gina has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.  She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Tien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tien, born in 1986, is an ethnic Thai woman living with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her eldest son is studying at primary school, and her daughter is at a kindergarten.  

Her family’s main income is from her husband's meager salary, and she also earns some income from other work to improve the daily meals of the whole family. Through her husband's monthly salary, they have enough to cover the family’s living expenses and save a little bit. But, the saved amount is not enough to pay her children’s education fees and that is the reason she wants to take a loan.

She very expects that the loan amount will help her to pay her children’s education fees and she will work hard to earn enough to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to pay her children’s education fees

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Lolita is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of bananas to sell for her buy-and-sell banana business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga is an ethnically Thai woman. She has participated in the program of M7-MFI since September 2013. She currently lives with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter, in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her two children are both obedient and good at learning at primary school. 

Her family's main income is from animal cultivation and breeding. After costs, this is just enough to cover living expenses, feeding the children and paying for their education. She wants to invest more in her children’s education but she doesn’t have enough money. She wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She will find extra work and work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI. She hopes the loan will help her children with better conditions for studying, and then they will have a bright future.

loans.use: to invest in her children’s education

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Teresita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional bundles of fishing net for her fishing business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of fishing net.

loans.name: Satrigul

texts.ru:
Сатригулу 26 лет. Она уроженка города Душанбе. Сатригул не замужем и пока не имеет детей. Она очень ответственная и целеустремленная девушка с большими планами на жизнь. К сожалению, она по обстоятельствам не смогла получить высшее образование. Сатригул как многие девушки не хотела сидеть дома и решила стать самостоятельной предпринимателем и создать свой устойчивый бизнес. 3 года назад Сатригул решила начать торговую деятельность. Она начала заниматься продажей женской одежды и по сей день Сатригул продвигает данную деятельность. В работе ей нравится общаться с людьми и помогать делать им правильный выбор в покупке одежды.
   Сатригул решила расширить свою деятельность и привезла новый товар на продажу. По причине нехватки финансов ей не удалось во время оплатить арендную плату за торговую точку. Ей срочно надо выплатить арендную плану, чтобы не потерять место деятельности. Она видит выход из положения только в получении кредита. Сатригул надеется на Вашу помощь. Поддержите ее!
texts.en:
Satrigul is 26 years old. She is a native of the city of Dushanbe. Satrigul is unmarried and does not have any children. She is a very responsible and goal-driven women with big plans for her life. Unfortunately, due to her circumstances, she was unable to receive a higher education. Like many women, Satrigul did not want to just sit at home. She decided to become an independent entrepreneur and start her own stable business. Three years ago, Satrigul decided to start a retail business. She began selling women's clothing and she continues this business to this day. At her work, she enjoys talking with people and helping them make the right choice in their clothing purchases.

Satrigul decided to expand her business and bring in new merchandise to sell. Because she did not have enough money, she did not succeed in paying the rent for her retail space on time. She urgently needs to pay her rent so that she does not lose her retail space. She sees the only solution to her situation as taking out a loan. Satrigul relies on your support. Please help her!

loans.use: to pay for the rental of her retail space.

loans.name: Merlyn Magdalena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Las Estrellitas se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Merlyn, tiene 22 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión  libre y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 8 meses de nacido. Su esposo trabaja en un hotel de la ciudad.
Doña Merlyn es una gran ama de casa y buena esposa que le gusta trabajar para así ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio vende ropa, zapatos por catalogo así como también productos de Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los  días y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella no tiene horarios fijos sale cuando está desocupada, deja a créditos y cobra cada 8 días, ella lleva 4 años en esta actividad la cual empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo .
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos y productos Avon y Yanbal. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con el primer crédito comenzó su negocio. Sus sueños son que su hijo nunca le falte nada.
texts.en:
The "Las Estrellitas" communal bank meets every fortnight in the city of Manta, This city is known for its beautiful beaches which are popular all year round and for being a beautiful city without rival with many tourists attractions.

Merlyn lives here. She is 22 years old and is in a common-law relationship. From this relationship she has an 8 month old son. Her husband works in a hotel in the city.

Merlyn is a great housewife and a good wife who likes to work to help her husband with the household expenses. She works in business selling clothing, and shoes from catalogs as well as Avon and Yanbal products ( beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women). She works every day and her method of selling is door-to-door. She has no set timetable, she goes out when she isn't busy. She leaves the items on credit and collects every 8 days.

She has been in this business for 4 years and she started it with the first loan she got as a member of the communal bank. This loan will be used to buy clothing, shoes and Avon and Yanbal products. She has been in the communal bank for 4 years and she likes it as she started her business with her first loan. Her dream is for her son to lack nothing.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes and Avon and Yanbal products.

loans.name: Mico Salasala Group

texts.en:
Amina, who is in her late 30s, is single with three children who are still in school.  She has been a food vendor for four years now.  She works from 5 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Amina's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to restock the items she is out of in her food store.  She dreams of improving her food business.

Amina will share this loan with her loan group "Mico Salasala," which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the items she is out of in her food store

loans.name: Fayziniso

texts.en: Fayziniso was born in 1964. She is a hardworking woman. Fayziniso and her husband have five children. Her husband is in security. Fayziniso always tries for the well-being of her children and six months ago she began a business in animal husbandry. Fayziniso feeds cattle some months and sells them in a local market. She is going to increase the number of cattle she feeds. She is asking for a loan of 500 somoni to buy cattle for increasing the working capital of her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing the working capital of her new business.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is twenty-eight years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Jenelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Jenelyn has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 45 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, chips, etc.

Nelly has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Nelly would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, chips, etc.

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn is forty-seven years old and married with three children who are in school. Jelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Jelyn has been in this business for five years.

In the future Jelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Norie

texts.en:
Norie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Norie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Jansie

texts.en:
Jansie works hard to support her family. Jansie is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional box of fish to sell.

Jansie has been in this business for ten years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Gulafzo

texts.en:
Gulafzo was born in 1995. She is a single girl from a rural area of Tajikistan. Gulafzo has grown up in a poor family. Her parents are farmers and always they wanted to see Gulafzo as a higher-educated person. 

She graduated school with excellent marks and successfully has applied to the Medical College. Now, she is a student of the second course and she studies well. 

Gulafzo now needs financial support for paying university tuition as her grandfather is ill and her parents need to use their money for his treatment. She is asking for a loan to pay for tuition and she awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition.

loans.name: Ma. Ley

texts.en:
Ma. Ley works hard to support her family. Ma. Ley is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional box of fish to sell.

Ma. Ley has been in this business for fifteen years now.

In the future, Ma. Ley would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling fruit in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fruit to sell for her business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her reach her goal of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fruit to sell

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her business buying and selling vegetables. Magdalena has been in this business for 9 years, and she earns more income from raising pigs and bamboo weaving.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda is 34 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, sugar, eggs, milk, etc.

Roda has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fruits.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, sugar, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase household goods like chips, eggs, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase household goods like chips, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace is 50 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by eleven farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Grace has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Grace also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Grace's Group will be able to receive a total of 4 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Gieng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Gieng, born in 1990, is an ethnically Thai woman. Though she is one of the youngest members of the group, she is always an exemplary leader in implementation of regulations and policies of M7-MFI. She currently lives with her husband in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from her husband’s salary, which is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount. But that amount is not enough to pay for her education fees because next year she will take examination to graduate from college. Therefore, she really wants to borrow a loan to pay for her education fees.

She expects the loan amount will help her have better conditions for her education. She will find a good job after graduation and has a bright future.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Azibet's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Azibet, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 60 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of ninw farmers in Kakamega South Distric, Kenya.  She is married and has three children.

Azibet is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Azibet says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2012, she has been able to consistently feed her family, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Azibet will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase a total of three solar lights as well as seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of four acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Ibrahim's Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim's Group is formed by 15 farmers in the Teso District and is being represented by Ibrahim, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 35 years old, is married and has four children. Ibrahim has been a farmer for ten years and is often referred to as a very reliable person.

Ibrahim isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed his life has changed; especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Ibrahim will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Ibrahim's Group will purchase a total of 7 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
Catherine's Group is formed by 10 farmers in Teso District and is being represented by Catherine, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 36 years old, is married and has four children. Catherine has been a farmer for six years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Catherine isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Catherine will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Catherine's Group will purchase a total of five solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of six acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve the harvest of maize.

loans.name: Andrea Mariuxi

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Las Estrellitas se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Andrea, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 1 años de edad. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Andrea es joven madre y esposa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y la crianza de su bebé se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ella aprovecha para salir en las  mañanas ya que a esa hora su mamá le cuida al bebeé y sale con más facilidad, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, lleva más de 2  años en esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva 4 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella aprovecha las ofertas. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia pues vive con familiares.
texts.en:
The Las Estrellitas Credit Group meets every 15 days in the city of Manta.  It is a city known for its beautiful beaches which are visited in every season of the year, and for being a city of unparalleled beauty, with many tourist attractions. 

Andrea lives here. She is 22 years old, and married.  She and her husband, a taxi driver, have a one-year-old baby boy. 

Andrea is a young wife and mother who sells all types of clothing and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and ladies’ accessories), in order to obtain her own resources with which to help her husband with the household expenses and the costs of raising their baby. 

She sells door to door, taking advantage of the morning, as that is when her mother watches the baby, and she can go out more easily. She sells on credit and collects every eight days.  She has been engaged in this occupation for more than two years, and with it, she earns money for the good of her family.

This loan is for the purchase of clothing, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics, among other things that she sells.  She has been in the credit group for four years, and she likes it because with the loans, she takes advantage of special offers.  She dreams of having a house of her own, as she lives with family members.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, perfume, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Эту талантливую и умелую женщину зовут Фотима. Она в возрасте 53 лет продолжает заниматься своим любимым делом шитьем. Благодаря этому своему умению она зарабатывает на жизнь и помогает мужу обеспечивать семью. Фотима со своей семьей живет в северной столице Таджикистана, в городе Худжанде. Она занимается швейным бизнесом у себя дома на протяжении 3,5 лет. Фотима шьет постельное белье и затем продает их на рынке. От этой деятельности она получает небольшой доход. В данный момент для продолжения деятельности ей необходимо закупить ткани, но для этой цели у неет нет средств. В связи с этим она обратилась за кредитом. На часть суммы кредита она закупит необходимые ткани, а на остальную часть хочет провести церемонию по случаю обрезания своего внука. Этот кредит очень важен Фотиме, она ожидает поддержки.
texts.en: This talented and skillful woman is named Fotima. She is 53 years old. She continues to work in her beloved profession of sewing. Thanks to this skill, she earns a living and helps her husband provide for their family. Fotima lives with her family in the northern capital of Tajikistan: the city of Khujand. She has run a sewing business out of her home for the last 3.5 years. Fotima sews bed linens and them sells them at the market. She earns a small income from this business. She currently needs to buy fabrics to continue her business but she does not have the money for this purchase. In connection with this, she requested a loan. With a portion of the loan, she will buy the necessary fabrics. With the remainder of the loan, she wants to carry out her grandson's circumcision ceremony. This loan is very important to Fotima; she awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy necessary fabrics, as well as to carry out her grandson's circumcision ceremony.

loans.name: Jersson Enrique

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Las Estrellitas se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive el señor Jersson, tiene 22 años de edad, está soltero y  vive en casa de sus padres. El está desde el inicio en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
El trabaja en un hotel de la ciudad por lo cual recibe un sueldo mensual, pero además para generar ganancias extra él también se dedica al comercio en lo que es la venta de ropa de todo tipo así también como productos de Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), el sale a vender en sus días y ratos libres ya que no es algo que le quite mucho tiempo y le permite ganarse algo extra que le sirve para salir adelante y ayudar a sus padres, el lleva más de tres años dedicado a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos y productos Avon y Yanbal. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia en un futuro.
texts.en:
The Estrellitas Loan Group meet every 2 weeks in Manta, a city well-known not only for its stunning beaches which receive lots of visitors throughout the year, but also for its unrivalled beauty and its many tourist attractions. 

This is where Jersson lives. He's 22 years old, single and lives in his parents' house. He has been in the loan group since the very beginning and he likes the help he his offered in the form of loans. 

Jersson works in a hotel in the city, receiving a monthly wage for his work. He also makes some money on the side by selling clothes as well as Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, perfumes and womens' accessories). He sells the products on his days off and in his spare moments and this enables him to make a bit of extra money, helping him to get ahead in life and help his parents out financially. He has been successfully doing this job for more than three years. 

He will use this loan to buy clothes, shoes and Avon and Yanbal products. His dream is to have his own house someday in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and Avon and Yanbal products.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard is an experienced farmer from Achajur village. She lives with her son, daughter-in-law and mother-in-law. Alvard’s son is employed in construction. 

To be able to meet her family’s needs, Alvard, with the help of her daughter-in-law and mother-in-law, is extensively engaged in agribusiness. They breed livestock, including cows and calves. They also cultivate wheat, corn, potatoes and plums, pears, apples, and grapes. Alvard’s son sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for them. 

Alvard wants to expand her agribusiness a little bit to be able to effectively meet the growing needs of her family. A loan of 1,500 USD will help her greatly and will enable her to purchase six piglets and some forage for the livestock. Alvard and her family rely strongly on the goodwill of the lenders and are thankful to them for their help in supporting the necessary loan amount.

loans.use: to purchase six piglets and some forage for the livestock

loans.name: Zaruhi

texts.en:
Zaruhi is from Artik town, where she lives with her husband and 2-year-old son. Zaruhi started agribusiness some years ago. She is now cultivating wheat, barley and potatoes. Zaruhi’s husband is an army officer, and Zaruhi has to manage the farming work herself. 

To be able to sustain her farm in the winter, Zaruhi asks lenders to help her with purchasing potato seeds (650 kgs).

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds (650 kgs).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a septic tank and sanitary service as his latrine is in poor condition.

loans.name: Zarine

texts.en:
Zarine is an experienced agronomist from the Spandaryan village of the Shirak  region. She lives with her husband, mother-in-law, son and daughter. To take care of their needs, Zarine and her family members are engaged in agribusiness. They are involved in the cultivation of potatoes. Zarine’s husband sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family’s income. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Zarine needs to make some investments. A loan of 700 USD will be a great support to this hard-working woman and her family and will enable her to purchase potato seeds. Zarine and her family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of the loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Narek

texts.en:
Narek lives with his parents in Armavir town. He studies at a university and dreams of becoming a doctor. 

To be able to pay for his university tuition, Narek asks for this loan. He hopes for lenders' support with his university costs and will be very grateful for the help.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a first-time client who is a poultry farmer, which business he has done for over three years. It's profitable though he feels challenged  at times when it comes to feeding the chickens whose appetite is rather high yet the cost of the feeds is also high. 

Benard is borrowing in order to buy chicken feed since he needs to feed them to be ready for sale within the next month. Benard is hard-working and resilient and thanks Kiva lenders through UGAFODE for the great service.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed

loans.name: Mungu Tubariki Group

texts.en:
Ummy, who is in her late 20s, is single with one small child.  She has been running a salon business for one and a half years now. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. every working day and is able to realize a good profit each month. 

This is her fourth credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania, and she managed to repay all the previous credits successfully. Ummy used the previous credits to buy hair products for her salon. She earned an extra income which she used to cover household expenses. Her dream is to manage a business selling wood.

She will use this credit to buy up-to-date salon products.  She will share this loan with her group, Mungu Tubariki, which consist of two members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon products

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik is an experienced farmer from Achajur village in the Tavush region. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law, two grandchildren and her brother-in-law. 

To assist her husband in earning a living for the family, Arevik is extensively engaged in agriculture. She cultivates wheat, corn, potatoes, cucumbers and grows plums, apples and nut trees. Her husband sells the agricultural produce in the local market and that is an important source of the family’s income. 

To continue running her agricultural business in a sustainable way, Arevik needs to make some investments in it; she needs to buy two piglets and renovate an agro machine. A loan of 1,100 USD will be a huge support to this hardworking woman. 

Arevik and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount to sustain their business.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and renovate an agro machine

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba is 27 years old and she is a hardworking woman with a great desire to progress in life. She is divorced and has not any child. She is very hardworking and successful business woman of her region. 

Later than 8 PM, she has been busy with buying and selling clothes. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experiences and skills help her to develop business and in this way improve her living condition. She wants to develop the business further but her income is small and she needs your help and mercy.

She is asking for a loan of 2,400 USD to buy seasonal clothes to increase working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothes for increasing working capital

loans.name: Aida Dolores

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Las Colinas Del Progreso esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.
La señora Aida tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ellos. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad. Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad.
Doña Aida con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, allí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, aunque reconoce que lo que más le gusta elaborar es ropa de mujer o de niñas ya que hay mas diseños y con estos aprende aun mas, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares, aunque también elabora prendas que luego exhibe en unas vitrinas que tiene en su local. Lleva más de 15 años con esta actividad la cual le permite salir adelante.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su situación económica.
texts.en:
Las Colinas del Progreso Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the El Progreso community, a very densely populated and marginal urban area of the city of Portoviejo.

Aida, 58, is married, and she and her husband have three adult children, one of whom still lives with them.  Her husband's a security guard.

Aida learned sewing and tailoring several years ago in an academy in town.  She started a small tailor shop in her home to earn her own income and make the most of her sewing and tailoring knowledge.  She earns a living making all types of clothing for women, men, and children, although she admits that what she likes most is making clothing for women or little girls because there are more designs and she learns even more from them.  She works on the basis of customer requests, although she also makes garments to show in some display windows she has in her space.  She has been in this line of work for more than 15 years and it allows her to make progress.

Aida's going to use this new loan to buy fabric and other sewing materials.

She has been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because of the help with loans.  Her dream is to keep on improving her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other sewing materials

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel has a welding shop in Tala town and has been running this business for 5 years and it has been profitable. He is 53 years old, and a widower with 5 children.

He will use this loan to buy more stock of metal and welding materials for use in making window grills and door frames. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in future he hopes to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy metal and welding materials for use in his business.

loans.name: Jucel

texts.en:
Jucel is 49 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Jucel works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Jucel requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

In the future, Jucel would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is married and she works hard to support her family. 

Nenita has a butcher shop business in the Philippines. Nenita has been in this business for 35 years now.

Nenita requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock for her butcher shop

In the future, Nenita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 43 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional household goods to sell .

Raquel has been in this business for nine years.

In the future Raquel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Katrina

texts.en:
Katrina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 27000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Katrina has been in this business for 3 years. Katrina earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Katrina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 13 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. She is married and has three children.

With a portion of this loan, Rose will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer. Rose plans to use the profits she gains this year to save more money for the future.

In total, Rose’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of five acres of land. They will also receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Philibus

texts.en: Philibus is a maize farmer from Rafin Tabo village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Philibus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Philibus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Philibus, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Surayo

texts.en:
Surayo was born in 1978. She is married and she is a very careful mother for her four children. She lives with her family in a rural area. 

Surayo’s husband is a farmer and he has a small income. So she is going to start her new business and in this way improve their living conditions.

Surayo is going to start a business with animal husbandry. She will buy cattle, feed them for some months and sell them to the local people. With this aim, she took part in a course called "To Get Ahead" from a women's organization and got a certificate. 

She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy cattle for organizing her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Ma. Elnor

texts.en:
Ma. Elnor is 40 years old and married. She has one child who is in school. Ma. Elnor works very hard to provide for the family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Ma. Elnor requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

In the future, Ma. Elnor would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Rosario works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing and raising pigs.  

Rosario is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rosario has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization. She joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children, Ummi, Peice and Clement.  

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Sara would have to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to take care of her immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sara can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40 per cent higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about her future, Sara  spoke about her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children and her hope to eventually become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Baktykan

texts.ru: Бактыган, 44 года, замужем, есть 4 детей. У Бактыган- среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством.Бизнес начала 18 лет назад с 4,000 сомов (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Бактыган на сегодняшний день ее бизнес приносит около 9,000 сом (KGS). На 1,90 Га земли Бактыган выращивает фасоль и картофель, также в хозяйстве есть 1 корова, 1 лошадь и 10 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной коровы. Бактыган является одной из трех участников группы "Кызыл-Туу". Доходы от кредита Бактыган планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Baktykan is 44 years old, married and has four children. Baktykan has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she practices crop farming and livestock breeding. She started this business 18 years ago with 4,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Baktykan's hard work, her business currently brings in about 9,000 som (KGS). On a 1.90 hectare plot of land, Baktykan grows beans and potatoes. She also has 1 cow, 1 horse and 10 sheep on her farm. To further develop her business, she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 50,000 som (KGS) to buy one cow. Baktykan is one of the three members of the loan group "Kyzyl-Tuu." Baktykan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase one cow

loans.name: Veronica Alexandra

texts.es: Doña Verónica tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos, mismos de los cuales 4 estudiando, ella comenta que trabaja en lo que mas puede para tener los ingresos para mantener a sus hijos, ella se dedica a trabajar al jornal de trabajo en el campo, a la crianza de animales y también a la venta ambulante de verduras y hortalizas, el crédito lo va invertir en la comprar chanchos ya que dice que es un buen negocio ya que para criar sus chanchos no gasta mucho porque es da de comer con las aguas que salen de los desperdicios asea aguas de lo que se lava los alimentos y entre otros, con cascara de papa  y el suero, Veronica  aspira seguir trabajando y de sus actividades tener para el pan de cada dia de sus hijos.
texts.en: Verónica is 41 years old, a single mother of 5 children, four of whom are studying. She comments that she works as hard as she can in having the income to support her children. She works as day labor in the fields, raising animals and also selling vegetables and greens itinerately. She will use the loan to invest in purchasing pigs as she says it is a good business as raising pigs doesn't cost much money. You just have to feed them with the water that comes from the remains, the water used washing food amongst others, potato peels and whey. Veronica hopes to continue working and from her businesses earn the daily bread for her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Jocel

texts.en:
Jocel is 49 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. Jocel works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Jocel has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Jocel would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jena

texts.en:
Jena is 36 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jena has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Jena requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Jena has been in this business for ten years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mahliyo

texts.en:
Mahliyo is a kind woman. She is married and has a child. She is a seamstress and has offered her services to local people for three years. Mahliyo sews a variety of women's dresses. She works hard every day to earn a living and provide her family with a better living standard. 

Mahliyo is asking for a loan of 1000 USD because she must buy medicines for her treatment as she is ill. Mahliyo is a repeat client of IMON and she has a good credit history. She awaits your mercy and really needs your support.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment

loans.name: Stefany Carolina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito El Nuevo Amanecer se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
Aquí vive la señora Stefany tiene 18 años  de edad, está soltera y estudia el último año de colegio.  Ella vive en casa de los padres.
Doña Stefany es una joven muy trabajadora que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarles a sus padres y para sus propios gastos que generan sus estudios se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella   sale tres veces por semana aunque también vende en su casa y en el colegio donde estudia, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 2  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo que le permite seguir adelante esperando seguir en sus estudios y algún día ser profesional
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, y ropa de niños. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer Credit Group [The New Dawn Credit Group] meets every 15 days in the city of Manta.  It is a city known for its beautiful beaches which are much visited in every season of the year, and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

Stefany lives here.  She is 18 years old, single, and studying in her last year of high school. She lives at home with her parents. 
Stefany is a hard-working young woman, who sells all kinds of clothing in order to earn her own resources with which to help her parents and pay for the costs of her education.

She sells door to door, going out three times a week, although she also sells out of her home, and in the high school where she studies.  She delivers her products on credit and collects every eight days. She has been engaged in this occupation for more than two years; and with it she earns the money that allows her to keep moving forward, as she hopes to continue with her education and someday be a professional.

This loan is for purchasing pants, shirts, and children’s clothing.  This is her second cycle in the credit group, and she likes it because the loans help her a lot.  Her dreams are to complete her education and be a great professional.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Alejandra  Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito El Nuevo Amanecer se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Alejandra tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una  hija de 5 años  de edad, la cual estudia en escuela, ella está esperando a su segunda bebé en su sexto mes de embarazo. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada
Doña Alejandra es una mujer que le  gusta ganar lo suyo por el bien de su familia, ella en sociedad con su suegra tiene un local en la casa de los suegros en el cual se dedican a la venta de comidas rápidas como  hamburguesas, papas fritas, hot dog, sanduches, tostadas, jugos y batidos de frutas así como también sodas, entre otras cosas que preparan y venden y que son del gusto de sus clientes que a diario asisten a su local a servirse sus alimentos,  trabajan todos los días en las tardes y noches, ya son más de 3 años con este negocio el cual les permite salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar víveres necesarios para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener su propia casa pues vive con los suegros.
texts.en:
The "El Nuevo Amanecer" communal bank meets every fortnight in the city of Manta. It is known for it's beautiful beaches that get many visitors all year long and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Alejandra lives here. She is 26 years old. married and from this relationship has a 5 year old daughter who studies in school. She is expecting her second baby, in her 6th month of pregnancy. Her husband works in a private company.

Alejandra is a woman who likes to earn her own money for the good of her family. She together with her mother-in-law have a stand at her in-laws house where they sell fast food like hamburgers, french fries, hot dogs, sandwiches, toast, juices, fruit shakes as well as soft drinks amongst the other things that they prepare and sell that their clients enjoy who come daily to eat their food. They work every day in the afternoons and evenings. They have been in this business for 3 years and it allows them to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy the food necessary for preparing their foods. She has been in the communal bank for 3 loan cycles and she likes it for the help the loans provide. Her dream is to own her own house as she lives with her in-laws.

loans.use: to buy food.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard lives in Artimet village, Armavir region. Her husband is a migrant worker in a neighboring country and Alvard lives alone and takes care of the farm. On the arable land, Alvard cultivates potatoes and sells them in the local market. 

To expand her potato cultivation Alvard is asking for this loan of USD 800 to purchase potato seeds (2000 kgs). With good credit history behind her, Alvard hopes for lenders’ support for her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds (2000 kgs)

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is an experienced farmer from the village of Amberd in the region of Ejmiatsin. She lives with her husband, daughter, son, daughter-in-law and two grandsons.  To take care of her family, Anahit is extensively engaged in agricultural business. With the help of her husband, she is involved in breeding a herd of cows, calves and piglets and in the cultivation of haricot beans,  potatoes and greens. They sell the agricultural products in the local market and that is the main source of the family's income. 

As life is getting more expensive over time, Anahit wants to expand her agricultural business in order to meet the growing needs of her family more effectively. A loan of USD 1,500 will be a huge help to this hardworking woman and her family, enabling her to purchase forage for the livestock, and supplies for renovation of the greenhouse (pipes and polyethylene cover). 

Anahit and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be thankful to them for helping to fund the needed loan to sustain their agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase forage for her livestock and supplies for renovation of her greenhouse (pipes and polyethylene cover)

loans.name: Sharapat

texts.ru: Шарапат, 43 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Шарапат среднее образование. В настоящее время она занимается животноводством и полеводством, по хозяйству помогает старший сын. Шарапат с большой ответственностью относится к своему делу. Ежегодно обрабатывает 0,3 Га земли, выращивает кукурузу и картофель, в хозяйстве есть 4 овцы. Шарапат обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) для покупки семян картофеля и удобрений для обработки почвы, чтобы выращивать экологически чистые овощи. Доходы от кредита Шарапат направит на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса, также хочет накопить на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Sharapat is 43 and married with four children. She has a high school education and currently works in animal husbandry and agriculture with the help of her oldest son. She treats her work with the utmost responsibility. Every year she cultivates 0.3 hectares of land where she grows corn and potatoes, and she also has four sheep.

Sharapat has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 120,000 KGS to purchase seed potatoes and fertilizer to amend the soil, in order to grow organic vegetables. She intends to put profits from the loan into further developing her business, and wants to save toward her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase seed potatoes and fertilizer in order to cultivate her land and grow organic vegetables

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
Jennie is 43 years old and married with seven children. She runs a general store in the Philippines. 

Jennie has run the general store for 11 years. She also earns an income from food vending and from buying and selling vegetables. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Jennie has requested a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy items to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, eggs and coffee.

Jennie has borrowed and paid 20 previous loans from NWTF and is now requesting a loan to further build her businesses. She aspires to saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, eggs and coffee.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Angelita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  Angelita is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional stock to sell like chips, soft drinks, canned goods, etc. for her general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like chips, soft drinks, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Aizhamal

texts.ru: Айжамал, 22 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2010 году. Благодаря упорному труду, Айжамал на сегодняшний день имеет 1 корову, 1 лошадь. Также у Айжамал есть 1,4 ГА собственной земельной доли, на которой она выращивает фасоль. Она в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 телят для откорма и реализации. Айжамал является участником группы "Кызыл-Туу", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Доходы от кредита Айжамал планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, что позволит улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en: Aizhamal is 22 years old, married and is a mother to two children. She has a secondary education. As an additional source of income for her family, she practices livestock breeding nad crop farming. She started this business in 2010. Thanks to Aizhamal's hard work, she currently has 1 cow and 1 horse on her farm. Aizhamal also has a 1.4 hectare plot of land on which she grows beans. To further develop her business, she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 60,000 som (KGS) to buy 2 calves to fatten up and resell. Aizhamal is a member of the lending group "Kyzyl-Tuu," in which there are two other members. Aizhamal plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further development of her business, which will allow her to improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase two calves for fattening up and resale.

loans.name: Akylai

texts.ru: Акылай 27 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей, образование- высшее. Уже 4 года она ведет свое хозяйство. Благодаря упорному труду Акылай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы и 6 овец, на участке мерою 0,59 Га она выращивает пшеницу и кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Акылай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на аренду земли для увеличение земельного надела, на котором она сможет выращивать экологически чистые фрукты и овощи. Доходы от бизнеса Акылай планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Akylai is 27 years old, married and has two children. She has a higher education. For the past four years, she has been running her own farm. Thanks to Akylai's hard work, she currently has 3 cows and 6 sheep on her farm, as well as a .59 hectare plot of land on which she grows wheat and corn. Her average monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her farm, Akylai turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 30,000 som (KGS) to rent a plot of land to increase her amount of land so that she can grow eco-friendly fruits and vegetables. Akylai plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to rent land for growing organic fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en:
Hannatu is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village in Kaduna state. 

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hannatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hannatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Hannatu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to buy food and clothing for her family and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer, 31 years of age, is married to a motorcycle driver and they're blessed with two children. She has owned and managed a transportation business in their village for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 250 daily. Her net income from her business is usually spent on the payment of their electric bills. 

Due to insufficient funds for her business, she would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of their motorcycle. She's hoping that her business will continue providing them a better way of living.

loans.use: To pay for the repairs and maintenance of their motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 42 years old and married. She and her spouse have been blessed with three children. She runs a hotel and has been in this business for 10 years. It has been profitable. She is also a dairy farmer.

She will be using this loan to buy more sugar, milk, rice, cooking oil, and flour for use in her hotel. She will use the anticipated profits to buy animal feed for her dairy cows. 

This is her fifth loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and she paid her previous loan successfully. Her future hopes are to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk, and cooking oil for use in her hotel business.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 38 years old and married. She has seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Erma has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from general store and buying and selling rice grains.

Erma is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Marivic has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from weaving. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Soso Group

texts.en:
This group is called Soso. It consists of four women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Nour is the leader of the group. She is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of six children living with them in a humble house in a poor area. The income of her husband is very limited and not enough to cover the necessary expenses of the family. She works as a beautician inside her house earning a small income. 

Nour's house lacks a lot of food materials and that thing makes all the members of the family feel inconvenienced. Nour doesn't have enough money to improve the living conditions of the family. 

For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to purchase food materials as sugar, flour, salt and other materials to cover the necessary needs of the family.

Nour hopes to provide her children with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase food materials as sugar, flour, salt and other materials to cover the necessary needs of the family.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a maize farmer from Chiroma village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Halima would have to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to take care of her immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Halima can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40 per cent higher than the market price at harvest. Halima, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family, and she hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer from Chiroma village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Iliya would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to take care of his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Iliya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40 per cent higher than the market price at harvest. 

Iliya, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Eliana Gladys

texts.es:
Eliana es una joven estudiante de SENATI, vive junto a sus padres y su hermana menor. Su madre para sacar adelante a su familia, trabaja como cosmetóloga, mientras que su padre trabaja de manera muy eventual como obrero de construcción.
Ella es una joven muy emprendedora, eligió su carrera porque estaba acorde con la economía familiar, pero cuenta ella que poco a poco le fue gustando al punto de que siente que esa carrera le permitirá sacar adelante a su familia, ya que es una carrera de mucha demanda en el mundo Textil.
Actualmente se encuentra cursando el Segundo Ciclo de la carrera de Confecciones Textiles;  debido al horario y a los cursos que está llevando se le dificulta trabajar y estudiar al mismo tiempo, por lo que le es muy importante contar con el apoyo de KIVA para poder continuar estudiando, ya que por la actual situación económica que está pasando su familia, le es muy complicado seguir costeando sus estudios.
Ella agradece el apoyo que KIVA brinda a través de los Créditos Educativos otorgados por IPFE, ya que brinda la oportunidad de continuar los estudios aquellas personas que tienen deseos de superación, pero sin embargo no cuentan con los medios económicos y eso es esencial para poder lograr algo en la vida, mejorar, crecer profesionalmente y como personas, para servir y ser útil a la sociedad, apoyando a sus familias, si realmente quieren lograr algo pues deben darse cuenta de que no existe barreras para hacerlo, con perseverancia y esfuerzo todo se logra.
texts.en:
Eliana is a young student at at SENATI. She lives with her mother and her younger sister. Her mother works as a cosmetologist to get the family ahead while her father works occasionally as a construction worker.

She is a very enterprising youth. She choose her studies thinking of the family's economy, but little by little she has come to like it to the point where she feels it will allow her to get her family ahead. It is a field in much demand in the Textile world.

Right now she is studying the second cycle of Apparel Textiles. Because of the timetable and the courses she is taking it is difficult to work and study at the same time. So it is very important to have the support from Kiva to be able to continue to study. The current economic situation of her family makes it very difficult for her to support her studies.

She is grateful for the support that Kiva has offered through the Education loans issued by IPFE as they offer the opportunity to people who have the desire to excel but don't have the economic resources needed, to continue to study.

This is essential to be able to amount to something in life, improve and grow both as professionals and a person, to serve and to be useful to society and support their families. If you really want to attain something you have to realize that there are no barriers to doing it. With perseverance and effort everything is attainable.

loans.use: to be able to continue her studies in Apparel Textiles to be able to successfully complete it and be a good professional.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yakubu would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Yakubu expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide his family with food and clothing, and in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
El Sr. Freddy tiene 39 años, acompañado, y también comenta que tiene un hijo, vive en la ciudad de Itá. Don Freddy se dedica al comercio, tiene una despensa bien surtida en su casa y también venta de helados, además es chofer de la empresa de ómnibus.
Es una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada, pues a través de sus labores trata de poder dar a su familia todo y que no tengan que pasar por necesidades-
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su despensa con todo tipo de insumos, como ser verduras, condimentos, carnes, productos a granel y otros. Está agradecido por la oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Freddy is 39 years old, partnered, and also says that he has a son who lives in the city of Itá. Freddy works in sales, and has a well-stocked general store in his house and also sells ice cream. In addition, he is a driver for the bus company.

He is a very hard-working and self-sacrificing person since through his work he tries to be able to give his family everything so they don't have to have times of need.

He asks for this loan to be able to stock his store with all types of supplies, such as vegetables, seasoning, meat, bulk products and others.  He is grateful for the opportunity that he is getting which will be a great help.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, seasonings, meat, bulk products, and others to sell.

loans.name: Guljamol

texts.en:
Guljamol is a responsible mother of two young children. Her husband is a farmer and he grows crops. 

His income from the agricultural activity is not enough for providing his family with all the necessary things. So Guljamol decided to start a new business and in this way to find a new source of family income. 

She is going to start a business with animal husbandry. She is asking for a loan of 500 TJS to buy cattle. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Heghine

texts.en:
Heghine is a young farmer from Eghegnadzor town. She lives with her husband and mother-in-law. Both her husband and mother-in-law are employed. 

To take care of her family’s needs, Heghine is engaged in an agribusiness. With the help of her husband, she is involved in keeping livestock. They keep cow, calves, and hens and realize the agricultural products in the local market. The latter is the important source of the family’s income. To continue her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Heghine needs to make some investments. A loan of USD 1,500 will be a huge support for this young hardworking woman and her family and will enable her to purchase steer and forage for feeding the livestock. As this is Heghine’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.
