Heghine and her family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of the loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase steer and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito El Nuevo Amanecer se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive don Carlos, tiene 35 años de edad, es padre soltero tiene un  hijo de 12 años el cual estudia en escuela. El vive en casa de sus padres. 
E4l señor Carlos es un hombre muy trabajador que le gusta ganar lo suyo para así salir adelante y darle lo necesario a su hijo, el cuida una cancha  por el cual recibe un sueldo mensual, pero el también tiene a su cargo el bar del lugar, allí el vende todo tipo de bebidas  como gaseosas, aguas, energizantes, cervezas, entre otras, además también vende empanadas, papas fritas y otros alimentos preparados. Trabaja todos los días desde las 14h00 hasta las 22h00, lleva 2 años con su negocio con el cual se gana la vida.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar: gaseosas, bebidas energizantes, aguas cervezas, entre  otros productos. Lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir con la ayuda de los créditos.
texts.en:
The credit group El Nuevo Amanecer meets every two weeks in the city of Manta.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round and for being a city with unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Carlos lives in Manta.  He is 35 years old and a single father to a 12 year old son who attends school.  He lives with his parents.  Carlos is a hardworking man who likes to earn what is his so that he can succeed and give his son what he needs.  He cares for a sports field and receives a monthly salary.  He also has a bar where he sells all types of beverages, including sodas, water, energy drinks, beer, and others.  He also sells empanadas, french fries, and other prepared foods.  He works every day from 2:00pm to 10:00pm.  He has had this business for two years and he earns a living from it.

He will use this loan to purchase sodas, energy drinks, water, beers, and other items.  He has been a member of the credit group for two loan cycles and he likes the help he gets from the loans.  His dream is to continue to move forward with help from the loans.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, energy drinks, water, and beer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in supplies, flowers, and decorations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To assist with paying for renovations, a new wax machine, and a chair for the hairstyling station.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 44 years old and married with seven children who are all in school. Lilibeth works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. Lilibeth has been in this business for 20 years.

Lilibeth requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Rosyl

texts.en:
Rosyl is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and earns additional income from fishing.

Rosyl has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and is requesting another loan to further build her businesses.

Rosyl is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her buy-and-sell fish business. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is from Meghri town, where she lives with her husband, mother-in-law, son, daughter-in-law, and two little grandchildren.

Lilia and her mother-in-law have been involved in cattle breeding for four years. The livestock that they developed includes three cows. Lilia uses the milk in the production of cheese and sells it locally. 

To enlarge her work, Lilia asks for this loan of USD 1,500. She plans to purchase a cow and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en:
Maryamu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Maryamu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Ummaru, Talatu and Nafisa.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Maryamu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Maryamu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Maryamu  spoke of her  ambition to use the additional income to educate her children and her hope to eventually become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hussaini

texts.en:
Hussaini is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Hussaini would have to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest to take care of his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hussaini can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40 per cent higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Hussaini expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide his family with food and clothing and, in the long run, to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Samaila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children:  Hassan, Shekarau and Sailas.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Samaila spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kayira Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KAYIRA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales, de l’habillement, de charbon et d’articles divers.
Les femmes du groupe KAYIRA sont à leur dix neuvième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente MAMOU, première personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter du riz, de l’huile, de la pomme de terre, de la farine boulangère et des condiments sur place chez les grossistes.
La vente des plats se fait en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 110 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group called Kayira is made up of married women. They have an average age of 44 and on average, five children. They all live in traditional families in the town of Fana, prefecture of Dioïla, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They made each other's acquaintance because of being related, or neighbors or friends. They sell cooked food, cereals, clothing, charcoal and various items. The women of the Kayira group are on their 19th solidarity loan. Wishing to satisfy the enormous demand of their clientele, they came to Soro Yiriwaso. 

Mamou, the Soro Yiriwaso client standing first from right to left, does not know how to read or write. She presently has a little restaurant business. She hopes to buy rice, oil, potatoes, flour for baking, and condiments locally, from wholesalers. She sells her cooked dishes for cash in the market to a mixed clientele. She expects to make a monthly profit of 110,000 F CFA which which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making cooked food to sell

loans.name: Miskol

texts.en:
Miskol is 34 years old. She is married and has four children. 

Miskol’s husband is a migrant in Russia and the money he sends is not enough for living. So Miskol started a new business six months ago. She feeds cattle and sells them in a local market. She works hard every day for 10 hours and she hopes her business is going well. 

She is going to increase the number of cattle she feeds and in this way develop the business. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy cattle for the new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle for her business.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs for her pig-fattening business.

Leonora has been in this business for two years. Leonora earns more income from selling vegetables. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, de 29 años de edad, no estudio, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 3 hijos y están estudiando.

Pedro, es agricultor, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 19 años, su padre le enseño la actividad.- 
Además, de la agricultura se dedica a la pesca y esta actividad le proporciona un ingreso adicional para  cubrir necesidades de su familia.

Pedro, camina 5 kilómetros para llegar a su lugar de trabajo y su horario de trabajo es de 6 horas al día.

Pedro, invertirá el préstamo para comprar lámina, hierro, cemento.-  Todo para mejorar la casa, ya que se encuentra en mal estado.

El préstamo el podrá arreglar la vivienda y su familia estará más segura, la necesidad a satisfacer será la de tener un vivienda digna para vivir.

Pedro, sueña con mejorar la productividad del maíz y el frijol,  porque en su comunidad ya son pocos los agricultores, el desea sembrar más terreno para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Pedro is 29 years old, and did not attend school.  He is married, and his wife is engaged in domestic work.  He has three children that attend school.

Pedro is a farmer, and has been engaged in this activity for 19 years; his father taught him this activity.   In addition to farming, he is engaged in fishing, and this activity provides extra income to pay for his family’s needs.  He walks five kilometers to get to work, and works six hour a day.  

Pedro will invest the loan in the purchase of metal sheets, iron, and cement.  He will use all of these materials to make improvements to his home as it is in disrepair.  The loan will enable him to repair his home, keep his family safer, and satisfy the need to have a decent home in which to live.

Pedro dreams of improving the productivity of his corn and bean crops because there are few farmers in his community.  He wishes to cultivate more land in order to have better income.

loans.use: to purchase of metal sheets, iron, and cement.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is a hardworking mother from Mayorga, Leyte.  She raises and sells hogs to support the needs of her family. Lea is a 35-year-old mother of two children, ages 12 and 7. In addition to her income from hogs, she works the land and grows rice. Because of difficulty in acquiring capital to sustain her livelihood, Lea began to look for other ways to come up with capital.

She is asking for a loan to purchase piglets and pig feed. These supplies will be used to increase her income. She will be able to raise healthy pigs which will be sold in the coming months. Lea's income will improve, and she will  start to pay her obligations.
She will be supporting her children's education, and at the same time, provide them with proper diets.

Lea would like to be successful and productive by expanding both of her businesses for sustainable living.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong, 49, is widowed and lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City, with her son. She started a general store 15 years ago. Huong sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt, and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular food and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business will run smoothly, and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en:
Khanh is 45 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Khanh and her husband earn money through their business manufacturing metal parts and screws, which she has been doing for six years. 

Khanh requested a loan, which she will use to buy a larger stock of metal materials to increase her production to meet her customers' needs. She hopes her business will ensure that her family members, especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to purchase metal materials to produce screws and metal products.

loans.name: Wunzooya Bimbilla - Masaka Group

texts.en:
Rabi is a 65-year-old hardworking woman from Bimbilla in the Northern region of Ghana. She is married and has seven children. Rabi is the individual pictured carrying paddy rice among the members who are standing.

Rabi is a member of a parboiled rice processing group that has been in business for the past seven years. The name of the group is 'Wunzooya Bimbilla - Masaka'. Rabi earns a good profit from the business because the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to process high quality parboiled rice for the local markets around Bimbilla and Tamale.

Rabi and ‘Wunzooya Bimbilla - Masaka’ Group have asked for a loan of 13,000 GHS. Rabi’s share of the loan is 600 GHS, which would be used to buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing. Rabi aspires to produce in large quantities in the future and earn more income, as well as repay this loan and support her family with good health care and education.

Rabi thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 59 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell nipa (palm frond mat) roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of nipa roofing to sell.

Emelda has been in this business for 18 years.

In the future Emelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Magola Del Carmen

texts.es: Magola es madre soltera, tiene 43 años de edad, y 4 hijos de los cuales  2 aun viven con ella y también una nieta le acompaña, Magola comenta que ha nacido y crecido en el campo y que la fuente de ingresos los es el trabajo al jornal y la crianza de animales, ella necesita el credito para comprar una vaca, y de este negocio  aspira  que le siga yendo bien para con los ingresos mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia ya que en la actualidad aun no tiene  luz eléctrica en  la casita en la que vive.
texts.en: Magola is a 43 year old single mother, and has four children.  Two of her children still live with her and she also has a granddaughter living with her.  Magola says that she was born and raised in the country, and her income sources are working as a day laborer and raising animals.  She needs the loan to purchase a cow, and from this business she aspires to continue doing well so that she can use the income to improve her family’s quality of life as currently she still doesn’t have electricity in the small home in which she lives.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. Editha is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, eggs and  milk.

Editha has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Editha would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, eggs and milk

loans.name: Nwahd Group

texts.en:
Nwahd is the same group that applied for a previous loan from Kiva lenders. It consists of the same members. The group hasn't completely repaid its first loan, but it is applying for a concurrent loan of 160,000 Yemeni rial from Kiva lenders.

One of the group's members, Nohad, used her portion of the first loan to buy fabrics and sewing materials to use in her business. She thanks Kiva lenders for the first loan, which helped her to expand her business. 

To attract a lot of customers, Nohad is requesting a second loan, of 40,000 YER, from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. She will use this loan to purchase additional quantities of fabrics and sewing materials, such as zippers and thread, to use in her business. She hopes this loan will be funded too.

loans.use: To purchase quantities of fabrics and sewing materials, such as zippers and thread.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia works hard to support her family. Lucrecia is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lucrecia has been in this business for 19 years now.

In the future, Lucrecia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mansir

texts.en:
Mansir is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mansir would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to take care of his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mansir can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40 per cent higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Mansir expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide his family with food and clothing and, in the long run, to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sunusi

texts.en:
Sunusi is a maize farmer from Babbar Saura village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sunusi would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sunusi can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Sunusi, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 45 years old and married. She has two children who are in school. Rosalina works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs and soft drinks.

Rosalina has been in this business for three years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment to set up her business sewing on contract for third parties.  She's a mother and head of household

loans.name: Al-Amira Group

texts.en:
Al-Amira is the same group, which consists of four members, who are Amal, Hayat, Haiam, and Entsar, without Sbot. They haven't yet completely returned the first loan given by Kiva lenders but are applying for a concurrent loan of 130,000 YER from Kiva lenders.
Amal is the same leader of the group. She applied for a first loan from Kiva lenders to purchase perfumes, incense, and henna to expand her business. She is thankful for Kiva lenders for their first loan, which assisted in enlarging her business. Amal applied for a concurrent loan of 50,000 YER from Kiva lenders to expand her business, more through buying more perfumes and henna to resell in her area. All the members of the group hope this loan will be funded too.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, incense, and henna to expand her business.

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en: Monaliza, 30 years old, has two children, both in school. She works very hard to provide for them. For the past 8 years, Monaliza has run a business buying and selling cellphone accessories in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional cellphone accessories to sell. In the future, Monaliza would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional cellphone accessories to sell

loans.name: Martha Susana

texts.es: Susana  es una joven casada, tiene 34 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos que asisten a la escuela, el esposo de Susana se dedica  a trabajar de jornalero, Susana es una señora muy activa en sus actividades ya que se dedica al jornal, a sembrar pequeños huertos de papas, a la crianza de animales menores y también se alcanza para cuidar y atender a sus hijos, Susana va a invertir el crédito en la compra de chanchos para seguir trabajando y comenta que con el apoyo de su esposo van a comprar un lotecito para tener donde hacer sus huertas de los productos.
texts.en: Susana is a young married woman; she is 34 years old and has 3 children who are all in school.  Susana's husband makes a living as a laborer.  Susana is a busy woman is she makes a living planting little potato gardens, breeding small animals and also makes time to take care of her children. Susana is going to invest the loan in buying pigs to be able to keep working.  She comments that with the help of her husband they are going to buy a small lot to have a space to make their own garden.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Thêm

texts.en:
Thêm works in agriculture. farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Thêm is 22 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Thêm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thêm has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Thêm faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thêm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry is 48 years old from Estancia, Iloilo, Philippines. She is married with three dependents ages 12, 16 and 19. Fifteen years ago, Cherry started raising hogs. She also sells home-cooked snacks like banana cue (deepfried banana in caramelized sugar) and camote cue (deep-fried sweet potato in caramelized sugar). Her business is thriving, but because she is supporting three dependents she needs additional capital to keep it going.  She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy piglets, feed, hollow blocks, cement, gasul (liquefied petroleum gas), sweet potato, banana, sugar, flour and cooking oil. Cherry hopes that in the future, her business will continue to flourish, and she can give her family a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, hollow blocks, cement, gasul (liquefied petroleum gas), sweet potato, banana, sugar, flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a Sari-sari store owner from the community of Estancia in Iloilo. A Sari-sari store is a little home-based grocery store that sells basic commodities in a certain community. She sells detergent, insect repellent, biscuits, cooking oil, candies, seasoning, shampoo, and salt.  She has been relying on her business for twenty years. Norma is asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, liquors, canned goods, bath soap, shampoo, and condiments to sell in her store.

Norma hopes to expand her business. Her income will be used for savings, eating a healthy diet, and reinvestment. 

Norma is 63 years old and has four adult children.

loans.use: to  buy soft drinks, liquors, canned goods, bath soap, shampoo, and condiments to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mujeres En Circulos Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres en Círculo está participando dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, todas y cada una de ellas está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para ir superando su situación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Claver, quien es la presidenta de este grupo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, comenta que es enfermera, pero para poder seguir creciendo y ayudando a su familia, ella también se dedica a las compras y ventas varias.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas varias y calzados, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group called "Mujeres en Círculo" (Women Circle) is participating in a program to eliminate poverty, each and every one of them is putting in her biggest effort to overcome the situation of poverty.  

One of the members is Mrs. Claver who is the president of the group.  She is a very hard-working woman; she mentions that she is a nurse, but that to be able to keep growing and helping her family she also earns money buying and selling various products. 

She is requesting this loan to buy varied clothing and shoes so that she can continue with her sales, as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy varied clothing and shoes

loans.name: Bendetta

texts.en:
Bendetta, 30 years old, is married. She and her spouse have been blessed with 3 children. For the past four years, Bendetta has been a farmer and the business has always been profitable.

Bendetta will be using this loan to buy chicken feed for her poultry, as well as fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and to service the loan. 

This is Bendetta's second loan term with VisionFund Kenya, having repaid her previous loan successfully. Her future hopes are to expand her farming, educate her children and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed for her poultry, as well as fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria sends you her thanks for your generosity, because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies which were needed for her business. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and expenditures.

Gregoria is sure that she can improve her business even more, if she takes another loan of 10,000 PHP. This new loan will be used to purchase additional products, such as rub and coffee products, that are needed in her business. Simultaneously, she can sustain the needs of her family with this assistance.

Gregoria wants to expand and grow her business. She also would like to give her children a better future. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work, and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise, such as rub and coffee products, needed in her business.

loans.name: Claudia Paola

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Las Estrellitas  se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Claudia, tiene 35 años de edad, está separada, pero de esa relación tienen tres hijos de 18, 7 y 3 años  de edad,  los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela, ella vive en casa de los padres.
Doña Claudia es una mujer muy trabajadora que  para salir adelante y para que a sus hijos no les falte nada se dedica al comercio, ella  la vende ropa, zapatos, entre otros productos que vende de acuerdo a la temporada, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres o cuatro veces por semana y también vende en su casa,  deja a crédito y  cobra por semanas, lleva 2  años que se dedica al comercio con el cual se gana el sustento diario de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos y todo de lo que ella vende. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con  los créditos. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The credit group Las Estrellitas (Little Stars) meets every two weeks in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited throughout the year, and for being a city of unsurpassed beauty with many tourist attractions.
Claudia, 35 years old, lives in this city. She is separated but has three children ages 18, 7, and 3. The older two are in school and the younger one is in preschool. She lives in her parents’ house.
Doña Claudia is a hardworking woman who, to get ahead and to ensure that her children have everything they need, makes her living selling clothing, shoes, and other products according to the season. She sells door-to-door, going out three or four times a week, and she also sells from her home. She extends credit to her customers and collects payments each week. She has been doing this for two years and in this way supports her family.
This loan is to buy clothes, shoes, and everything else that she sells. She has been in the credit group for two years and likes it because of the help she receives from the loans. Her dream is to provide the best education for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, etc.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito El Nuevo Amanecer se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora María tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores  de edad, el menor de ellos aun vive con ellos y  estudia en universidad. Su esposo trabaja en el muelle.
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta ganarse la vida realizando varias actividades, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa la cual ha ido aumentando con el paso de los días, ella también prepara almuerzos para entregar y muy pronto espera instalar un salón de belleza pues también está estudiando  belleza en un centro artesanal de la ciudad con el cual espera ganarse algo mas por el bienestar de su familia. 
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir su tienda. Lleva 12 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante mejorando cada vez más su negocio y su vida familiar.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer Credit Group [The New Dawn Credit Group] meets every 15 days in the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches that are much visited in every season of the year, and for being a city of unparalleled beauty, with many tourist attractions.

Señora María lives here. She is 44 years old, and married.  She and her husband have four grown children, the youngest of whom is still living with them and studying in the university.  Her husband works on the docks. 

Doña María is a woman who likes earning a living, carrying out various activities. She has a small grocery store in her house, which she has been expanding over time, and she also prepares take-out lunches.  Very soon, she hopes to set up a beauty salon, as she is studying beauty in a vocational training center in the city.  With this, she hopes to earn more for the well-being of her family.

This loan is for purchasing groceries to stock her store. She has been in the credit group for 12 years, and she likes it because the loans are quick. Her dream is to make progress, improving her business and the life of her family more and more.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Fátima Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito El Nuevo Amanecer se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Fátima, tiene 52 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. El marido es albañil.
Doña Fátima es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ella trabaja dos o tres horas al día ya sea en la mañana o en horas de la noche en sus recorridos, ella también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, la mayoría de sus productos son para entregar ya que cuenta con mucha clientela que siempre le compran, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, lleva más de 10  años en esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse lo suyo.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas y ropa de niños. Lleva seis años  en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
"The New Dawn” Credit Group meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are much visited in all seasons of the year, and for being a city of unequalled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Fatima lives here. She is 52 years old and has a common law marriage from which there are three children, all adults, one of whom still resides in Fatima's house. Her husband is a bricklayer.

Fatima is a housewife who, to obtain her own resources, and with this, to help her husband cover household expenses, dedicates herself to commerce. She sells clothing of all types door to door. Fatima works two or three hours per day, either mornings or during evening hours, on foot. She also sells from her home, when her customers visit. The majority of Fatima's products are delivered to her many customers who always buy from her. She sells on credit and collects each eight days. Fatima has done this for more than ten years, and it permits her to earn her own money.

This loan is for buying pants, shirts, and children's clothing to sell. Fatima has belonged to her Credit Group for six years and she likes it for the help it offers through the loans. Her dreams are to do the best for her family.

loans.use: buy pants, shirts, and children's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 47 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional charcoal to sell.

Nelia has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling charcoal for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fruits and vegetables.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Nelia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase fish, meat and vegetables to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to pay for additional quantities of vegetables, fish and meat products she needs in her business. The more items displayed at her stall the better. More items to sell will result in more profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary Joy wants to own and manage a supermarket someday. She dreams to give her family all their needs. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week in a setting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fish, chicken, and processed food products.

loans.name: Gam

texts.en: Gam, 35, is divorced, and has a son. She lives with her son in Ho Chi Minh City. Gam started a food stall, selling pork and noodles, 10 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of food and furniture, in order to better satisfy her customers. Gam hopes her business will run smoothly, and will generate a higher income, to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and furniture for her food stall.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients, such vegetables, spices, meat, etc. for her food vending business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 3 years. She earns additional income from food vending and buying and selling fruits and vegetables.

Jocelyn has successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients, such as vegetables, spices, meat, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story:

Cecilia is 63 years old, is married and mother of four. All of her children are married and live on their own. Cecilia lives in Huitzilzingo, a suburb of Mexico City, where she has lived all her life; her parents were born there. She describes herself and her family as a united and happy one. 

Cecilia makes a living by selling dried chilis and seeds, such as beans, lentils, chickpeas, and various species. The business is located in her house and is open Monday to Saturday, from 10:00 am to 3:00 pm. Her husband helps her in the business.

Cecilia asks for this loan to stock up her store, specifically to buy mole, frying dough, species, beans and dried chilies. She considers herself a good borrower.

loans.use: to stock up her store, by buying beans, mole, frying dough, beans and dried chilies.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a second time borrower with UGAFODE Microfinance Limited. The previous loan helped him to boost his business, and that's the reason he is coming for a second loan.

David is predominantly a cattle keeper and this has accorded him the experience of differentiating between the good and bad cows when he is buying for selling.

He will also take advantage of this season to buy cattle cheaply using the loan and later sell at a profit. He is a hard working and honest person who repays his loans diligently.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening

loans.name: Shaibu

texts.en: Shaibu is a maize farmer from the village of Babbar Saura in the state of Kaduna. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Shaibu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Shaibu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Shaibu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Chiểu

texts.en:
Mrs Chiểu works in agriculture farming food.  She is 57 years old and is married with 4 children.  She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Chiểu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Chiểu faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Chiểu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to remodel her house, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter runs a butchery shop in Tala town. He used his previous loan to buy goats and sheep for slaughter and it was profitable.

He is 37 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 3 children. He has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stock of meat to sell. This will enable him to serve more customers and make more income which he will use to repay the loan and will even have more savings as well.

This is his fifth loan term and he repaid his previous loans successfully. His future hopes are to be successful in his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat to sell.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan is a 20-year-old university student, and the unmarried second son from a family with four siblings. Currently, he is a student majoring in management, in his second year at university. Chan lives in Svay Reang province in Cambodia. His mother works on a village finance team, and his father is a construction worker. Because he lacks finances to pay his university fees for three years, he has decided to get a loan. With the loan, he will be able to earn a bachelor’s degree, and have a chance to find a job which will help improve his family’s living conditions. For his dream after graduation, he hopes to have a good job making a decent salary.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Shitu

texts.en:
Shitu is a maize farmer from Babbar Saura village in Kaduna state.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Shitu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Shitu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Shitu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell ginger business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Analyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of ginger to sell.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of  ginger to sell for her business.

loans.name: Cervella

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Cervella works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling ginger in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Cervella is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of ginger to sell in her business.

Cervella has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of ginger to sell

loans.name: Alhaji Safiya

texts.en:
Alhaji Safiya is a maize farmer from Dankwaire village in Kaduna state.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Safiya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Safiya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Alhaji Safiya, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Emmanuel Daniel

texts.en:
Emmanuel Daniel is a maize farmer from Badamasi village in Kaduna state.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel Daniel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Emmanuel Daniel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Emmanuel Daniel, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a sink, toilet and bath tub with plumbing in his house. His latrine is no longer usable.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Concepcion works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables and food vending. Concepcion is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pig fattening business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Concepcion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito El Nuevo Amanecer se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Gladys, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo  mayor de edad que  aún vive con ellos. Su esposo es chofer y artesano.
Doña Gladys es una gran ama de casa y buena esposa que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio vende yogurt, así como también productos de Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja toda la semana ella todos los días recibe el yogurt en su casa al por mayor el mismo que luego distribuye en su casa o entrega a domicilio, así mismo realiza las ventas de sus productos, deja a créditos y cobra cada 8 días, lleva más de 15 años en esta actividad la cual empezó con uno de los créditos que recibió del grupo .
Este crédito es para comprar yogurt y productos Avon. Lleva más de 18  años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos comenzó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su vida y su negocio.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer Credit Group [The New Dawn Credit Group] meets every 15 days in the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches which are much visited in every season of the year, and for being a city of unparalleled beauty, with many tourist attractions. 

Señora Gladys lives here. She is 56 years old, and married. She and her husband have a grown son who still lives with them.  Her husband is a taxi driver and an artisan. 

Doña Gladys is a great homemaker and a good wife, who likes to work in order to help her husband with the household expenses.  She sells yogurt, as well as Avon products (beauty items, cosmetics, perfume, and ladies’ accessories). She works all week, receiving a bulk quantity of yogurt at her house, which she then distributes from her house or by home delivery. She delivers on credit and collects every 8 days.  She has been engaged in this occupation for more than 15 years, which she started with one of the loans that she received from the group.

This loan is for purchasing yogurt and Avon products.  She has been in the credit group for more than 18 years, and she likes it because she started her business with one of the loans. Her dream is to make progress in her life and her business.

loans.use: to purchase yogurt and Avon products.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is a fish vendor living in the town of Mayorga, Leyte. She sells fish to the people in her community. She is a 42-year-old married woman with nine dependents. Seven of them are still attending school. Due to financial problems, Esperanza is in need of help to attain her goals.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional fresh fish for resale, which will help to increase her income. She could then sell a variety of fresh fish and cater to her customers' needs as well. This could create higher earnings and she could start to manage her finances. She will provide her family with good food and better living conditions. She could continue sending her children to school for a brighter tomorrow.

 Esperanza dreams to expand her business to make it productive and also to lead to sustainable livelihood in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy additional fresh fish for resale.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en: Cecile is a hard working woman who is engaged in multiple businesses.  She is from Estancia, Iloilo, Philippines.  She is married with four children ages seven to fourteen. Cecile buys fresh fish from the fishermen and sells it at a profit. She also buys frozen meat products like chorizo (cured, sweet pork sausage) and longgan iza (sausages flavored with indigenous spices made from chicken, beef, or even tuna) to sell. In addition to this, Cecile also makes peanut butter to sell in the community. Cecile needs additional capital of 20,000 PHP to buy sugar, peanuts, fish, chorizo and longganisa for her businesses. Cecile is inspired to work hard so she can finance the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, peanuts, fish, chorizo and longganisa.
